1253322221.content:
(This first chapter takes place during chapter 87, “Tokyo Has Godzilla, San Francisco has Batgirl”.)

Within the confines of a secret, underground base, there existed a shadow organization designed strictly to handle meta-humans; Cadmus. Ever since the arrival of The Justice Lords, scientists and military types have been brought together to prepare for what many believe to be an inevitable fight with so called superheroes. Of course, once the Fat Justice League came about, there were many who wondered if such an organization was still necessary, and yet, many others who believed that such a question was completely idiotic. One person in particular who fit that latter category could also easily be mistaken for a member of the FJL herself. They didn’t call her “The Wall” for nothing.

Amanda Waller was easily the FATTEST member of Cadmus, truly a wall of blubber. She was as big as she was imposing, and as jiggly as she was deadly. While much too rotund for field work for an average human, she was the type who could pull any string she wanted to succeed in her missions, letting others risk their lives for the country while she sat on her big fat butt. However, at this moment, Amanda Waller found herself witnessing the moment that Cadmus had been waiting for all along…and she was anything but happy. She didn’t even notice the door to her office being open, as her eyes remained firmly focused on the monitor she was watching.

“Dinner time, Ms. Waller.” The girl said as he sat down a very large, very heavy platter of food, much to his relief. However, his sigh was soon followed by a gasp, as Amanda spoke three words that neither he, nor anyone else ever expected to hear her say, “I’m not hungry.” The glass of water the girl was carrying next hit the floor, but once she managed to follow Amanda’s gaze, it became quite clear what killed her appetite. A blob of rampaging blubber that used to be Batgirl was right in the middle of a major city, and getting bigger and bigger as she devoured every superhero that came near her. However, soon after the girl started to watch, the two of them then witnessed the Teen Titan known as Starfire stepping in. Much to their shock and awe, she not only absorbed the fat right off of Batgirl, but got her to cough up all of the heroes in the process. By that point, the girl had to turn and leave, unable to look at the screen any longer. Thus, Amanda Waller was left alone with her thoughts.

Every possible response to a superhuman threat that Cadmus at their disposal quickly raced through her mind…and one by one, she came to an unfortunate conclusion, “It’s not enough. NOTHING we have is good enough. Doomsday, The Suicide Squad, Ultimen…they’d be Roasted Turkeys for all of them now. Chemical V has given them an even greater edge than before, and that spell that Zatanna cast on them, even if they ate each other, they would just…” And just like that, her eyes lit up. Amanda Waller had surprised even herself for missing a fatal flaw in the FJL’s power. The plan just came to her right then and there, and thus, a delectable aroma suddenly wafted to her nose.

Roasted chicken, glazed ham, macaroni and cheese, chili, and chocolate satin pie; not one of these dishes were meant for just one person. Everything, from an entire bird to a whole pie was in front of Amanda Waller, and a third of such proportions could have easily satisfied an ordinary individual. She was in no way ordinary, and the rumbling that came from her grand belly made that quite clear. She licked her fat lips, and gleamed at the banquet before her, now saying to herself, “Actually, I think I am hungry.”

What followed was an eruption of rampant chewing, with her mouth wide open at all times with every bite. A cow would have had more manners than her at that point, as Amanda became anything but controlled and collected as she gorged. The moment that chicken was in her grasp, she ripped every last bit of its flesh from the bones like it was trying to get away from her. She grunted and groaned loudly between bites, pushing herself as wildly as she could as her teeth mashed down every bite with such ease. The macaroni didn’t last thirty seconds in her grasp, and she practically drank down the chili, upturning the bowl as soon as it hit her ravenous maw. No matter how spicy or thick it was, it was soon lost to her bellowing gut, which roared for more food. She then practically pounced onto the ham, sinking her stubby fingers into it just as her teeth did the same. Like a lion eating a gazelle, she tore huge chunks of flesh off the mash and loudly slurped and nommed them down her gullet, bits of food and saliva spraying everywhere in the process. When at last it came time for the pie, Waller became akin to a pig at a trough, ravenously, almost mindlessly munching down anything sweet and tasty that her gluttonous fat maw could find. She ate and ate and ate and ate and ate and ate, until there was absolutely NOTHING left.

*BUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRP!!!*

Even with the base’s soundproofing, everyone could always hear when Amanda Waller had polished off a meal. This time around, they were just lucky the indicator had come out of the attic and not the basement. Her eating was always truly a sight to behold, and would have revolted many, but Amanda couldn’t care less. However, as she leaned back in her now groaning chair, with her hands placed on the stained and strained clothes fighting to contain her now solid belly, she realized that the only reason she stopped eating wasn’t just to let loose gas. No amount of that could ever slow her down, and she preferred being gassy when she ate. No, no, what got her to stop, as she realized with great surprise, was that tonight’s dinner had been lighter than her usual servings….and yet, her belly was silent.

“Full?! Already?!...It’s just the stress ruining my appetite. Still, this does make me all the more certain that I’ve got the right idea.” She said to herself. She thought the situation at hand was terrible enough, but to find out that it was affecting her dinner time crushed any lingering doubts or anxiety she might have felt. Hauling her big fat ass up, she began heading towards one of the labs.




Soon, Amanda Waller was standing in a testing chamber, completely devoid of clothing. She just stared ahead, waiting for the procedure to begin, and not caring about her exposure. It was necessary for her to be in the buff for the experiment, and anyone caught leering instead of glancing would be handed their walking papers. Soon, Professor Hamilton, who stood ready at the controls nearby, spoke up once again with some concerns, “I’d just like to go on record one more time and start how completely insane this all is. I mean really, Amanda, think about what you’re doing! If you would just give me a little more time with the Galatea Project-

“That Supergirl clone idea of yours? Hamilton, we no longer have the time to wait for you to grown your own personal Power Girl. Chemical V is the main source of power behind the Fat Justice League, and from what we saw in that footage, Zatanna’s revival spell. If the Teen Titans hadn’t been there, everyone there would now be fat on Batgirl’s ass.” Amanda paused after that. For a moment, she pictured herself taking on Batgirl, and wondered if she could beat out her magically powered super appetite. Soon though, she went back to making her case, “The bottom line is, they can be stopped, and since I’m not in their little club, and for other obvious reasons, I am the best candidate we have to choose from. So let’s get this over with. Hit me.” A tubby and voracious non-leaguer, who could negate Zatanna’s spell just by it not being cast on her at all; Amanda Waller was about to become the FJL’s greatest enemy.

With the press of a button, Chemical V gushed down into her chamber, and Amanda took a deep breath before she became completely submerged. After only a few seconds, the mutating liquid was drained out, leaving Amanda Waller lying on the floor. Professor Hamilton was the only one brave enough to check in on her, leaving anyone else in the room out of sight of his progress. However, they soon thanked God that they averted their eyes as they suddenly heard him scream his lungs out, but only for a few second, as his cries were replaced by a sickening slurp and munching. Everyone soon felt shivers running down their spines, especially when a thunderous belch rattled the steel walls. What followed next was what would surely ring in their nightmares, “I’m still hungry.”

"Yes, I was told to arrive at this location and converse with "Robin"." she explained herself.
"That's me." Robin stuck out his hand, but found that the girl just stared at it. "Um, your supposed to shake it." he explained.
"Oh." the girl surmized that this must be some form of earth greeting. When she grabbed Robin's hand though, not only did it feel like it was being crushed, but when she shook it, she sent him flying.

"Oh no! Robin are you injured? Please accept my apologies." fortunately she accidentally tossed him onto the couch. Robin snapped out of his daze.

"So, what's your name?" he asked.

"Koriand'r, though I believe in your language it is Star-Fire." she said. "Starfire, that's a very, pretty name." Robin said.
"Thank you." after she thanked him, there was a moment of silence, and the two blushed. Right now Robin was really confused, he had no idea why he just faltered like that. This wasn't exactly the first time he'd talked to a hot girl, or even an alien.
"Maybe I'm just being professional" he figured, foolishly.

"So, tell me about yourself Starfire." that was classic.
"Very well, I-" she paused, and did something else Robin hadn't expected.
"Has the temperature risen in this room?" he watched as Starfire started to lift off her top.
"Starfire wait!" now this was another first for Robin. He was trying to make a girl keep her clothes, on. Now, you must understand how bizarre this is. Robin the boy wonder was not only known for his ways under the covers, he was also known as being the king of getting any girl out of their clothes. He could do it with his eyes closed, he do with just a few words, he could do it with the right amount of bird-a-rangs, sometimes he just looked at FJL members, and something would pop off.

Upon learning this, it was decided my planet should establish a peaceful alliance with your world, since we have had confrontations with the Gordanians too. As princess of Tameran, it was my responsibility to come to your world and do so. Things have changed however, yes?" she finished.

142.title: Meet Starfire

choices: In walks a green dude in purple tights
Both the cybernetic teen and green dude walk in
1422.content:
Robin stood up to see who was coming in. He was so grateful for the distraction; things were getting awkward very fast between him and Starfire. The alien girl was so much different then the more loose and playful girls he usually hung out with. As odd as it was, the orange skinned alien was more down to earth then the bolder girls of the Fat Justice League. With all of them, Robin knew were he stood, they were horny girls and he was a young stud who could give them what they wanted. With Starfire, he didn’t know what she wanted, but he was pretty sure it wasn’t sex. She seemed so innocent and Robin would bet money she was also a virgin. Virgins were the one thing Robin didn’t know how to deal with. Rampaging aliens were easy, mad scientists were a snap, out of control robots he could deal with, and hot to trot fat babes were his specialty, but virgins were the one thing he didn’t know how to handle. If he was lucky, the next member of his team would be sexually active or at least know how to deal with emotional situations like the one he was dealing with now.

“Hello,” a soft, monotone voice spoke up from the front door. Robin stared at a floating figure, hiding under a large cloak and cowl. Nothing could be seen of the person, but their coldly staring eyes. Robin wasn’t even sure if the person was male or female until they floated over to him and removed the cowl. Robin stared into the pale, emotionless face of the newest member. She had a cute face; Robin wondered idly how it would look once she gained some weight. She had no real distinguishing feature except a tiny jewel on her forehead.

Realizing that he had been staring, Robin put out his hand to greet his new teammate. “Hello yourself, my name’s Tim, but call me Robin. It’s a pleasure to meet you…” he trailed off, trying to entice the floating girl to give her name and she his hand. The pale girl simply brushed him aside, taking a seat beside a smiling Starfire before calmly saying, “Raven, just Raven.”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you Raven, I hope we can be good, good friends,” the ever sociable Starfire said as she opened her arms to hug her hopefully new friend. Raven took one look at wildly smiling alien and scooted over quickly before she could be wrapped in a hug.

“I don’t do touching,” she simply said to Starfire, whose happy expression immediately dropped. Moping like someone had kicked her puppy, Starfire crossed her arms over her chest, trying not to cry at the refusal of her hug. An uneasy silence settled in the room from the coldness Raven was showing. Robin stood there in thought, trying to think about how he could salvage this uncomfortable first meeting. Sitting down between the brooding girls he turned to Raven with a friendly, open smile.

“So Raven, mind telling us something else about yourself beyond your name? You seem to have some flying powers, are they natural or were you born with them?”

“None of your business,” was Raven’s instantaneous response. Robin frowned, most super heroes loved to talk about how they got their powers, but Raven seemed to go completely icy when he mentioned it, not that she was acting too warm before.

“Okay, forget about how you got your powers, how about the reason you want to use them to fight crime? Personally, I feel like it’s my duty because I grew up in Gotham city, where crime was everywhere. I wanted to make my city safer, and now that I’ve done that, I want to do the same here.”

“My reasons are my own,” Raven said without any emotion at all in her voice. She looked at Robin, clearly bored by everything that was going on. “If you’re done, could you tell me where I’ll be staying. I got some unpacking to do.”

“No!” Robin shouted heatedly. He was getting frustrated with this, he was trying his best to be nice, get to know her, and even not trying to flirt, but he was being brushed aside rudely. He wanted to turn his new team into a shinning beckon of light and justice like the Fat Justice League, but how could he do that when his teammates couldn’t stand to be in the same room with each other?

In the spur of the moment, he grabbed Raven firmly by the shoulders and pulled her close to his face so she couldn’t ignore him. “Listen Raven, we’re a team now, you can’t act like you’re the only person in the room. We’re going to be risking our lives everyday protecting this city and I need to know I can trust you to watch my back. Just try to open up, no one here is your enemy.”

“I told you, I don’t do touching,” Raven said with more emotion then she had shown since arriving. Robin blinked, unsure of what to say, but he didn’t get a chance because Raven moved forward quickly, trapping Robin in a kiss. Starfire gasped as she saw her new friends kissing, only unlike her kiss with Robin, Raven’s kiss was much more forceful and intense. Raven pushed her lips against Robin’s, pushing her tongue into his mouth and pressing it against his own. As the kiss continued, Raven clasped her arms around his neck, tilting her head to the side to allow the kiss to deepen further. Robin returned the kiss the best he could, but he was so caught off guard he couldn’t keep up. What had happened to the cold and rude girl he had been talking to a few seconds ago? Raven started grinding her torso against Robin’s chest. Robin could feel her hardened nipples rub against his chiseled physique. Robin was finally getting into it when the light bulb above their heads shattered. The sound of the light bulb breaking snapped Raven out of it and she instantly pushed Robin away. Her pale face turned crimson red as she lifted up her cloak to clean the mixed saliva from her lips.

“I told you, I don’t do touching,” Raven repeated to the astonished faces of Starfire and Robin. Sighing loudly, Raven realized she just couldn’t pretend what had happened never happened. She was going to have to do the one thing she hated most, explain. “I’m sorry for kissing you, okay. Monks in another dimension raised me, teaching me how to control my powers. I was all alone, never knowing anyone, but the monks who weren’t the most sociable. All that time cooped up has left me a little… emotionally unstable. I’m not good around people and when a cute boy comes near me, I can’t really control myself.”

“So you think I’m cute?” Robin joked, getting a blank stare from Raven.

“Raven that is so sad,” Starfire gushed. “To be all alone must have been very not enjoyable. You need friends, so therefore, I will be your friend Starfire and you will be my friend Raven!” The excited alien smiled cheerfully and prepared to try for another hug, but one glare from Raven made her back down.

“Starfire’s right, you need friends if you’re going to get reintroduced into society. You can count me as a friend too,” Robin boasted confidently. He always had a soft spot for loners who wear black. Raven was unaccustomed to living with other people, so he’d help her. Besides, that kiss had been awesome, maybe he they could try it again once they got better equated.

Raven stared between the two friendly faces, unable to think of anything to say. She had never had a friend before, the monks had been her tutors, never speaking to her unless to teach. If Raven hadn’t had a firm grip on her emotions, she might have cried. Quietly, she summed up what she was feeling in two words. “Thank you.”

After wiping the sweat off her forehead and once she calmed down her breathing, Raven said what anyone would say to someone who didn't know about sex.

Now outside, the team had much better surroundings to demonstrate their abilities.
Cyborg was the first up. His new teammates watched as his arm actually turned into a cannon "Ooooh."

Starfire stood before everyone with a confident grin.

“Now, now Jinx, no one is being digested yet. We still have some things to do before that can happen. You’ve done well so far, don’t disappoint me now. If I hear one gurgle from inside you, I’ll be most angry.”

“I’m sorry,” Jinx quickly blurted out, abandoning all her ire as she stood before her employer. Normally, no one spoke to her that way and didn’t end up inside her, but her boss was different. She had been hired by this man along with Mammoth, Gizmo and someone other male super villain. The third man wasn’t important because he wasn’t around anymore. He questioned the boss, calling him a coward for sending them out to do a job while he sat back. Their boss had responded to the disrespectful villain through a display of his skills. Jinx still felt sick whenever she thought about what the boss had done to the recently deceased villain. Who knew that could be ripped off so easily?

Since seeing her boss in action, Jinx had fallen into line, doing everything he asked of her without question or concern. She had been curious about why she had to bring back a super hero alive, but one look at his one moving eye had silenced any questions. She was better of not knowing anyway, she really didn’t want to get too involved with this man anyway. She had accepted one mission and she had completed it. She had been told to meet her employer in an abandoned warehouse with the hero and here she was. Now, she could hopefully leave and never have to see this man again.

“Sir,” Jinx nervously said, lowering her head to avoid eye contact. “May I spit up the hero and leave? I’m sure you have people to see and mutilate, so I’ll best be going.”

“I think it best you stay, at least until the second phase begins. After that, I’ll have little use for you.”

“Righty-O,’ Jinx cheerfully said even as she started to break into a cold sweat.

She had been so stupid to get involved with this man and his mystery employers. The minute she saw his one-sided black and one-sided orange mask she should have run. Everyone knew who this man was, or at least knew one of his many names. He was the one-eyed devil. He was the deadliest man alive. He was Deathstroke the Terminator. He was Slade, the world’s greatest assassin.

“Patience, everything will soon fall into place.”

Jinx nodded. She was sure Slade was right, everything would work out as he planned it always did. The only question Jinx had, was her survival part of Slade’s brilliant plan?
142231112111111111211122.title: Love and Evil

choices: While the Titans fought, Robin faced Slade
While the Titans fought, Robin faced Slade and Jinx
1422311121111111112111221.content:
Beast Boy lead the way, following Cyborg's transmission on his communicator. The others followed close behind, eager to save their friend. Robin knew best how drastic a situation this was. If Cyborg had been eaten by a league member, Zatanna's spell would have brought him back to life. In the belly of a villain, the only place he would brought back in was the afterlife.
They would not let that happen.

Eventually, they reached the signal's location. It was eminating from a condemned building, one of the perfect hiding places for super villains.
Raven used her powers to pry off the wooden boards blocking the entrance. Everyone stepped in with caution, preparing themselves for anything.

"It is very dark in here." Starfire pointed out. Once they cleared the daylight coming in from the doorway, the rest of the building was pitch black.
"Tell me about it, I can't see a thing." Beast Boy said. Although he couldn't see, he did remember who was next to. Unfortunately, so did she.
"Beast Boy, get your hand off my ass." as Raven growled at him though, a single light was flipped on. The Titans looked and saw that below it was a saliva covered Cyborg.

"Oh man!" he tried to wipe the spit off himself.
"Cyborg," the sight of his friends lifted his spirits though.
"She just coughed me up, they can't have gone far." Cyborg said as Robin helped him up. After that, the entire room suddenly became illuminated, and the Titans found themselves surrounded by Slade's minions. Faced with the trap, not only did the Titans quickly prepare themselves, but Robin came up with a battle cry on the spot.
"Titans Go!"

Robin brought out his bow staff and slammed it into their bodies. It took a few hits to bring down one foe, and many others came at him from other directions. Fortunately, Robin had been trained by Batman, so multiple enemies were nothing new to him.

As four of them charged at her, Starfire licked her lips. Her massive body flew forwards, and her massive mouth opened up. All four of her opponents were quickly trapped within her jaws. Unfortunately, Starfire soon realized she could not eat them, as a very unwelcomed taste came to her tongue. She forcefully spit them out, and they impacted the wall. Some exposed circuitry confirmed her suspicions.
"Robots!" she scraped her tongue to get the taste off.

As bad as it was for Starfire, finding out they were fighting robots meant that the Titans didn't have to hold back.
Beast Boy quickly turned into a rhino, and charged at them. Any machines that weren't trampled by him were impaled on his horn.

Another group closed in on Raven.
"If there's one thing I hate, it's fighting on an empty stomach." her voice was surpressed, but the rage in her glowing black eyes said it all. That, and the fact that she crushed all of the bots in an energy field.

Cyborg had no problem taking down machines, though it was pretty annoying how they kept jumping on him to to pry him open. After repeatedly throwing them off, he activated his sonic cannon, and blew them away.

While the Titans were holding their own, Robin quickly found an opportunity to end this.
"Titans, move!" as everyone had fought, the remaining robots had been cornered closely together. As his team got out of the way, Robin pulled an explosive disc from his utility belt.
BOOM!!
That was that.

*THOOM!* *THOOM!*
Soon though, the Titans felt the ground shake.
"What now?" Robin asked, right before the floor opened up beneath him "Aaaaahh!".
"Robin!" Starfire and Raven both said, but were soon faced with a bigger dillema. Bursting through the walls, was a creature, 8 feet tall, and made entirely out of concrete "Cynderblock".
"Great, someone else we can't eat." Raven pointed out.

As their enemy atually roared at them, the Titans leaped back into battle.
Cyborg tried to punch him, but soon found out the hard way that his opponent was much stronger than him. He was knocked back into a steel beam.
"You will tell us where Robin is now!" Starfire ordered as she fired her starbolts. Cynderblock was blown back, but he quickly retaliated with another punch. It caught Starfire off guard, sending her flying through the air.

Raven tried to use her powers to slice apart her enemy, but all it did was scratch him up. Seeing her effort was in vain, Beast Boy turned into a gorilla, and latched onto his back. He tried pounding his fists on him, and when that didn't work he bit him, which quickly broke his teeth.

As Cynderblock tossed him off, Raven launched an energy ray at him. While Cynderblock tried to block that, he also had to withstand Starfire's punches. Both he quickly forced off.
"What does it take to stop this guy?" Cyborg asked. Starfire quickly pondered this question, and came up with an answer.

"Raven, launch me at our foe." it was an odd request, but Raven found the strength to lift Starfire's girth up, swing her around a few times, and then when her friend was facing Cynderblock, her powers were stopped. Everyone watched as Starfire turned around in mid air, making her backside aim at Cynderblock.

"You gotta be kidding me." Beast Boy soon realized there was nothing to joke about, as Starfire's huge, skimpy clad ass knocked him to the ground.
As he layed groaning on the ground, Starfire quickly grabbed where his neck would be.

"I will ask only once more, where is Robin?" she spoke with the menacing glowing eyes.
Cynderblock was able to point behind her, and Titans soon saw a hidden staircase suddenly open up in the wall.
1422311121111111112111221.title: Titans Go!

14223111211111111121112211.content:
While the Titans began their battle with Cinderblock, Robin was falling down a long shaft towards parts unknown. When he reached the bottom, he tucked his legs in and rolled as he hit the ground, saving himself from any injury. No sooner did he hit the ground did he hold up his staff and ready himself to fight. Robin breathed quickly as he surveyed his surroundings, finding no one in sight.

“Interesting. It seems all your extracurricular activities haven’t dulled your senses Robin.”

The cold, mirth filled voice behind Robin made him tense up. He hadn’t sensed anyone behind him. Reacting quickly, he spun around and brought his bo staff down on the enemies head. Casually, his attack was deflected by the adversary’s own staff. Robin leaped back, still in a fighting position, ready to bring it to whoever it was that was there.

A figure stepped forward, his one good eye glimmering with amusement as he looked at Robin. “Hello Robin, I suppose it would be impolite not to introduce myself.”

Robin narrowed his eyes, glaring angrily at the masked man. “No, it would be impolite to kidnap one of my teammates and try to kill me and my friends.”

“True, but an introduction is still needed,” The man straitened up, holding his weapon at his side as addressed Robin. “I go by Deathstroke the Terminator, but you may call me Slade.”

“I don’t care what your name is. You’re going down!”

Robin leaped into the air, his staff raised over his head, ready to bring it down on Slade’s head in one mighty stroke. Slade just stood there watching as Robin came down, not acting until he was a half a second from hitting him. In one graceful turn, he pulled a pair of katana’s from their sheaths at his sides and parried Robin’s attack. The boy wonder was pushed back. Disorientated, Slade dashed forward with his blades raised. He knocked Robin’s staff out of his hand with one sword and used the other to cut through Robin’s utility belt. Before Robin’s tools could fall to the ground, Slade delivered a powerful haymaker to Robin that sent him crashing into the wall.

“Whoa,” Jinx gasped from her hiding place deep in the shadows. When Slade had told her that they would be having an uninvited guest, Jinx had offered to back him up. She might have been terrified of the dangerous assassin, but she couldn’t let him be captured, at least, not until he paid her.

Her help was responded to with cold laughter that made her skin crawl. She was told with no uncertain terms that she could only watch and if she got involved in anyway, she would void her contract with Slade and become his new target. Jinx shuddered as she remembered her conversation with Slade before Robin’s entrance. When Slade threatened her life, he said it with the same ease someone would say when someone spoke about the weather. It further hammered into Jinx’s head that she wasn’t dealing with just another masked super villain, but an honest to God monster.

“What happened?” Robin moaned as he rubbed the back of his head. One second he was coming down and the rest was all a blur of steel and fists.

“You made a mistake, something that usually end with death when you deal with me.”

The cold touch of steel pressed against Robin’s jugular. He lifted his eyes to see Slade above him, his sword against Robin’s throat. The blade held steady against Robin’s throat, remaining close enough to make sure that any movement he took would send the blade through his neck. Even with death so close, Robin didn’t flinch, staring up at Slade with fortitude to not show any weakness.

Robin managed to smile weakly as the blade pressed against his throat. “Let me guess, you’re not going to kill me because I’m part of some silly, complicated plan you have to take over the world?”

His face might have been hidden behind a mask, but Robin knew Slade was smiling right now. “Something like that.”

Slade withdrew his sword, turning his back to Robin and sheathing his deadly weapons. Robin gingerly returned to his feet, not attacking even though the enemy’s back was turned. It had nothing to do with playing fairly; Robin hesitated because if he attacked again all he’d accomplish was being sent crashing to the ground again. Slade was quicker, stronger and most likely smarter then the young hero. What he needed to stop this lunatic was his teammates.

“Robin, the reason you’re not minus a head is because of one thing, I need an apprentice and after searching the globe, I’ve decided you’ll get that honor. You’re training with Bruce has made you strong, but I can make you stronger. Join me and you’ll have everything any man could ever want,” Slade calmly said with his usual bit melodrama.

Robin’s eyes shot open at the name of his mentor being spoken. Things had just gotten even more complicated if this monster knew the identity of Batman. Forcing himself to not give away anymore, Robin readied a curt come back to the villain’s offer.

“I’m Robin, Not Anakin Skywalker. Try peddling the Darkside to someone else because I’m not stupid enough to join you, Darth.”

“Stubborn, just as I expected,” Slade darkly chuckled, not insulted in the least by the forthright no he’d gotten.

“Robin!”

The sound of Starfire’s shrill voice calling his name was the sweetest thing Robin had ever heard. With a little backup, his team could take down this wannabe world conqueror, putting an end to whatever evil plan he had before he could get started. Getting into a fighting position, Robin prepared for round two, but Slade had other plans. He was casually walking away, in no real hurry to escape the coming heroes. Robin watched him go, knowing that if he followed, the faster man would dash away before he got close to him. With his back turned, Slade gave Robin a parting gift.

“Think about this Robin, fighting crime has become secondary to satisfying your carnal desires. You relish the feel of your flesh against fat to the feel of your fist against a villain’s skull. I’m not asking you to turn to evil, but to go further into a darkness you have already stepped. I offer you a world of unearthly pleasures that you have lust for more and more as time has passed. What you want in your heart isn’t to be a hero, but a master of all women. That path can be reached only with me and by accepting what you are. Do not deny it, most of all to yourself.”

At that moment, everyone barged in, ready to kick some ass. But Slade was already gone.

“Lover Robin, are you well?” Starfire exclaimed as she rushed to her lover’s side. She placed a hand on his shoulder, but he didn’t respond. He just kept staring off into the darkness. Was Slade right? Did all he care about was sex? During the fight, his mind had kept thinking about getting back to the tower and having some fun with his two new ladies. His mind had kept going back to sex, no matter what the situation. Sometimes he got excited about fighting a villain just so he could watch them get eaten and add some extra fat to a woman he was banging. Who was he, a hero or a lover? And how far would he go to get as much love as he could?

“Lets go home,” Robin said as he walked away with his team, delving deep into the dark stairway.
14223111211111111121112211.title: What Bad Guys are Made of

142231112111111111211122111.content:
Now back at the tower, the titans were trying to find any information on their mysterious new adversary.
"Deathstroke, aka Slade, top notch assassin, criminal mastermind, and probably the last good super villain out there." Cyborg brought up what little information there was on his computer.
"That's all you can find on him?" Raven asked.
"That's it. The FJL's been after this guy for months and all they know about him is his first name. No identity, no prints, no past, this guy's like a new age Joker." Cyborg said.

"Speaking of which, what's the deal with Robin?" Beast Boy asked. All of the titans were wondering the same thing. Their leader hadn't said a word about his encounter with Slade since they found him. Right now he was brooding just as much as his former mentor, and nothing could break him out of that state. They had tried everything, Cyborg said he needed a second player on game station, Starfire tried using both her kind words and sensual body, but Robin just said he wasn't in the mood. Soon after words, Beast Boy joked about trying to turn into a flying pig.

"Oh! I cannot stand the thought of not being able to comfort Robin. I must try harder to raise his spirits from doom and gloom." Starfire was now more determined than ever. She'd get her man to smile even if she had to grow larger than the tower to make it happen.

"Wait Starfire." she paused however as her other lover spoke up.
"I don't think you should try just yet. I've been in Robin's shoes before." Raven said.
"Why were you wearing Robin's footwear?" Starfire asked. Raven just shook her head.
"What I mean is, I know that he isn't going to want to talk to anyone for a while, he just needs some time alone." Raven explained.
"No! As his lover, it is my responsibility to ensure Robin's happiness." Starfire stormed off. With or without Raven's help, she was going to get Robin out of this slump.
Raven just sighed and hurried after Starfire. He heart was in the right place, but if she didn't keep an eye on her, who knows what might happen.

With the girl's gone, Beast Boy turned back to Cyborg, finding him looking at another villain's file.
"Jinx, former member of the Fearsome Five, escaped from S.T.A.R. Labs, has the power to cause bad luck for her enemies. Guess that means a trip to her gut. She's got a nice bod though." Cyborg said as he admired her corpulent form through that tight costume.

"Dude!" he jumped at Beast Boy's voice though. When he turned around though, he saw that his friend wasn't angry like he sounded.
"I gotta hand it to ya. You know how to pick 'em." Beast Boy said with his fist extended. Jinx may be a villain, but that only made her hotter.
Cyborg just fist pounded with him.





Meanwhile, Robin had plopped himself down on the couch and in front of the television. Normally, if a crime ever got him this worked up, he'd be spending every waking second to try and figure out the villain's next move. Right now though, he couldn't think straight. Slade's words had really struck a chord with him. No one had ever questioned his actions in the battlefield or bedroom, but now he was starting to feel like he should ask himself.

As Robin flipped through the channels though, a part of him was hoping some television could get his mind off this, putting his mind at ease if only for a moment. Plus, after considering that Slade might be right, he couldn't look Raven or Starfire in the eye.
He finally settled on an old Twilight Zone episode, and even as he dropped the remote, eventually his uneasy mind entered a daydream state.

***Daydream***

All of the FJL members were lining up to board the seeming endless supply of Javelens in the tower. Through the sea fat women, Batgirl eventually found herself in front of the line, and Robin was their waiting for her.
"Glad you could make it." she said.
"Yeah, but I won't be able to fit in here. I'll have to catch the next one." Robin explained.
"Alright. man I cannot wait to get there, I hope martians taste good." Batgirl said.
"Well either way, the white martian base has to be taken care of before they make it here." Robin pointed out.
"I gotta hand it to you Tim, organizing a mission like this is pretty impressive." Batgirl pointed out. Her Robin was becoming quite the mastermind.
"Here." she was then handed something.
"What's this?" she asked.
"Some reading material for the long flight." Robin explained. Batgirl just looked at the title.
"To serve women. I like the sound of that." she winked at him.

At the back of the line, Raven had been given her copy by the Martian Manhunter. As he handed it to her though, she noticed that the look on his face was more expressionless than usual. Putting that aside, she opened the book, and gasped.
She tried to rush out of line, but J'onn wouldn't let her.

"Barbarra! Don't get on the ship. This is just a mock title, the book is called, To Enslave Women!" she said. Batgirl's smile immediately dropped as the scary music played. She looked down at Robin, who did nothing but smirk.
"No, NO!" she knocked him aside and tried to run, but was soon faced with Superman. With one shove he forced her into the Javelen. As she kicked and screamed, Superman turned back to Robin, showing Slade making sure the mind control chip was firmly in place. Robin's grin widened.

***End Daydream***

"Robin? Robin?"
He suddenly jerked out of his fantasy with a startle. He dropped his defenses though once he saw Raven and Starfire "Oh, it's only you.".
"We came to see how you were feeling." Starfire sat down beside him. Raven did as well, and both times Robin felt his own weight bounce up from the couch.
"I'm fine, really." Robin returned to his former state. Raven didn’t reply, but of course Starfire did.

“Oh Robin, I wish you would tell me why you are so quiet. I can’t stand seeing my friend and lover unhappy.” Starfire persisted.
“I appreciate that Star, but really there’s nothing to talk about.” Robin said. Raven then finally stepped in “Fine, we’ll just stay here with you.”. Robin didn’t protest, not out loud anyway, and he seemed to feel a little bit began when his girls snuggled up against his body.

“It’s a cookbook!” they arrived just in time to see the twist of the episode. It was hard for Robin to watch this with that fantasy was still fresh in his head. He didn’t say anything though, fearing he might hint at what was wrong.

“Please Mr. Chambers eat.” Robin nearly gasped when he suddenly saw his head on the alien’s body, and Batgirl in place of Mr. Chambers.
“We wouldn’t want you to lose weight.”
He rubbed his eyes, and that horrible sight disappeared.

“This is similar to what is happening to your world, yes?” Starfire noted the similarities with the show and real life.
“Hardly Starfire, the FJL is a force of good.” Raven pointed out.
“Exactly.” Robin added with a fake smile.

“How about you?”
Robin froze, and slowly turned to whoever questioned his true nature once more.
“You still on earth, or on the ship with me?” he breathed a sigh of relief when he saw it was just the actor talking.
“It really doesn’t make a difference because sooner or later, it will all of us be on the menu. All of us.”.

That unjustified act of fear actually caused Robin to calm down as well. The fear and anxiety from before quickly went to the back of his head, but just to make sure it stayed there, he turned to Raven and Starfire.

“You know, it’s been a long day. I think we all need to do something ‘fun’.” He smiled. Both Raven and Starfire shared his grin. Right now, Robin just wanted to clear his head and show these two how much he cared for them. This problem could be addressed tomorrow.

“Oh, Raven could you shut off the tv?” Robin requested.
“Sure.” She floated back. As she held the remote though, the closing monologue caught her eye.

“The recollections of Michael Chambers. More simply stated, the evolution of man. The simple process of going from dust, to dessert. The concept of being the ruler of a planet, to an ingredient in someone’s soup. It’s tonight’s bill of fare, from the Twilight Zone.”
142231112111111111211122111.title: To Enslave Women

1422311121111111112111221111.content:
Robin walked out of his room forgetting quickly about his dream with his arms around Raven and Starfire. He had so much on his plate to worry about, but having them both with him was taking a lot of the pressure off. At first, he had been concerned that having a sexual relationship with members of his team might be a bad idea. It’s hard to make think strait when you have two babes clinging to you. But things were turning out great. Instead of distracting him, the girls were helping him keep a clear mind. He never forgot his duty, even when he was with both of them.

Pulling away from Raven and Starfire, Robin walked towards the communications room. He had a call to make.

“I better call Batgirl, she’ll want to hear about our first mission and maybe she can give us some more insight on this Deathstroke character.”

“Oh fanny sticks, I forgot about Senior Batgirl!” Starfire squealed as she went into a tizzy. Hovering above the ground, she bit her nails and started mumbling about being in so much trouble. Watching his teammate go into a go to pieces, Robin groaned as he pieced together Starfire’s distress from the mumbled jumble of words she was spouting.

“You forgot to restore Batgirl and Hawkgirl back to life after you ate them?”

Starfire nodded meekly, near tears from her huge mistake. Robin quickly moved to comfort the freaked out alien, while Raven shook her head at the sheer foolishness of Starfire. Only she could completely forget about eating two women the size of a small couch. Starfire really was a scatterbrain and as odd as it was, Raven kind of liked that about her. It was nice to have someone around that was so brash and reckless, while at the same time tried to do everything right. For Raven, who had to be calm and think before she did anything, having someone around that was the opposite was refreshing.

“Why don’t you stop worrying about getting into trouble Starfire and bring them both back. If they’re angry I’m sure you can smooth things over with a little private fun.” Raven was comforted to see Starfire catch the innuendo and giggle softly. She was finally starting to understand that something’s could be fixed with just a roll in the hay. It was something Raven knew after seeing the sex club that had once been the Justice League Watchtower. All it took was sex to keep today’s heroes happy.

“Yes, I will bring my teachers back and if they are upset with me, I will do the fucking with both to make up for the blunder I committed against them.” Robin nodded, not to just to bringing Batgirl and Hawkgirl back, but also to the sex part. Seeing his girl get it on with the two other sexy girls was something Robin would very much like to see. Raven nodded as well, she had only suggested the sex to reassure Starfire that everything would be alright, but once she got into her head all three women in bed together, she felt her own libido come to life.

As several very graphic fantasies ran through the perverted heroes minds, Starfire pulled two hairs from the top of her head and let them touch the ground. She could resurrect her past meals through anything organic from her body. A hair, a broken nail, even a drop of sweat. It was handy when you needed someone you’ve eaten to be alive posthaste. She watched with anticipation as her two digested teachers were revived. As the tiny strands of hair became living breathing people, everyone’s eyes were glued to the sight. Not because of how incredible it was that a whole human body was growing from locks of hair, rather that the human bodies were three things, female, fat and naked. Batgirl and Hawkgirl appeared on the ground lying face first, their big, meaty asses pointing in the air.

Starfire covered her face in embarrassment and chuckled nervously. “Oops, I meant to bring them back vertical.”

“It’s okay, you did a good job,” Robin quickly said, not breaking eye contact with Batgirl’s huge, upright rump. He had fucked that ass many times, but he never got tired of looking at it. The thing was like the Grand Canyon; you never get tired of looking at it. Robin thought wittily that he should start calling Barbara’s ass the Grand Canyon; it certainly did fit the curvy rump.

“That was fun,” Hawkgirl groaned, as she was the first to get up. Her body tingled in a way that was unfamiliar to her. Not an unpleasant feeling, just different. Next to her, Batgirl started to get up and immediately she reached for her mask, but found it missing. Even with the lull in crime, the heroes still tried to hide their true identities. Her custom gone, Batgirl’s identity as Barbara was revealed. Luckily, everyone in the room either knew her identity already or was a hero who could keep a secret.
Knowing the feeling of exposure that comes from going unmasked, Robin handed Barbara one of his spare domino masks, which she put on quickly.

“Nice to see you all again,” Batgirl loudly exclaimed as she righted herself in front of the young heroes. She had to keep up a pretense of authority for the younger generation, even when she was completely exposed. Raven, Robin and Starfire stood at attention for their superior, even as they lustfully looked over her huge, naked figure. Hawkgirl joined her fellow FJL leader, giving the group something else to ogle. Figuring that they had given the youngsters enough of a free show, Batgirl got down to business.

“So, what’s happened since we were digested?”




“Deathstroke the Terminator, huh,” Batgirl murmured as she went over Robin’s report. The five heroes had moved to the main room and sat down at the dinning table to go over recent events. The two senior superheroes had changed into standard civilian clothes, which were still tight and small enough to show off every jiggly part of them.

“I don’t think the Leagues ever dealt with this Terminator guy before. I’ve heard of him, but he’s kept off our raider until now. Wonder why he’s sudden decided to pick a fight with us now that we’re stronger then ever?” Batgirl left the question hanging in the air. No one had any idea what went on inside Slade’s head, but they knew he had to be up to something big. Deathstroke had outlasted all the big name criminals by being cunning and ruthless, but most of all by remaining in the shadows. For whatever reason, he had stepped into the light, bringing with him mystery and danger. Deathstroke was the worst kind of criminal, an unknown.

“I’ll have the Watchtower try to dig up some information about this illustrious assassin. Maybe find out whom he’s worked with in the past or known contacts. Tomorrow we’ll strike first and take him down before he can do anymore damage.” Hawkgirl slammed her fist into her palm, excited at the prospect of a new super villain to take down. All the sex she’s been having has been great, but she still misses the days of kicking bad guy butt.

“Why tomorrow?” Robin asked as he leaned back in his seat. He didn’t like how Batgirl Hawkgirl were taking over the investigation. Deathstroke had attacked his team, making him their enemy and responsibility to stop. This was Robin’s first solo mission and he wanted to stop Slade with his team, not wit the whole Fat Justice League along for the ride.

“We’ll find out more tomorrow because tonight we’re having a party. You fought your first big bad guy as a team, that’s enough reason to celebrate. I’m going to get everyone I can from the FJL over here and throw you the best party you’ve ever had,” Batgirl chuckled as she ruffled Robin’s hair playfully. Robin pushed Batgirl’s chubby hand off his head, annoyed at being treated like a kid by his past teammates and lover. Batgirl ignored him and waddled out to make a few calls. Getting some people here would be easy with the mention of a few words like ‘food’, ‘party’ and ‘young virgins’.

“An Earth party! How exciting!” Starfire clapped and floated up into the air. “I must find Cyborg and Beast Boy and tell them we shall be having a party.”

“Might be fun. I’ll get to see some of my old playmates again,” Robin said while grinning toothily. He had been with nearly every female member of the league, sometimes as a lover and sometimes as a snack. Having them partying in his new headquarters created a lot of opportunities to live out his old days.

Everyone was excited and on his or her way, that is all but Raven.

“But I thought it was going to be just the three of us to…” Raven stopped talking when she saw everyone was gone. Batgirl and Hawkgirl had gone to call the guests, Starfire had gone to tell the rest of the team and Robin had gone to make sure he had plenty of lube and fresh sheets ready. Sighing, Raven sulked off. She dully hoped that Robin and Starfire would not ditch her when the party started, but knowing that dozens of bigger, more beautiful female super heroes would be there made Raven assume she’d be spending the evening sitting in the corner. “Get to the control room, now!” he dashed back into his room and before the girls could blink, Robin was in his costume and was out the door again. Unwilling to disobey their leader, the girls quickly followed, and Starfire and Raven made no effort to get their clothes back on.

Now assembled before the main monitor in the living room, the Teen Titans stood before the image of a very unnerved Zatanna.
“Titans, I just delivered Robin and Beat Boy some very disturbing news. Last night, Harley, Ivy, and Batgirl secretly met in Gotham city. Once there, Batgirl planned to disclose some information about a threat that could endanger the entire league, but last night something happened and I lost contact with all of them. Based on what little information Batgirl shared with me, most of which involved that guy “Slade” that you fought a few days ago, I believe they’ve been kidnapped.” the Titans gasped as Zatanna told them all she knew. While most were trying to piece this together and coming up with completely different scenarios, and a certain girl did nothing but put on a phony look of shock and try to stay hidden behind Starfire and Raven, all of them did wonder one thing.
Where were the big three?



*Meanwhile*



Her eyes heavy and with her head still throbbing, Harley Quinn managed to wake up, only to soon wish she was still out cold. The first thing she noticed was that where ever she was, it pretty hot. Next, she saw her tubby arms and massive legs were shackled at the wrist and ankles. The metal chains were connected to a big, red rock against her back. Right away she tried to break away, but found the bonds too tough. This did not add up, her increased size had given her the strength to do battle with the likes of Killer Croc, who she proudly body slammed and then devoured.

“Ivy? Barbarra?” after failing a few times, she finally noticed her girlfriends next to her and bound to similar rocks in the same fashion. Upon hearing their names, both Gotham gals awoke and displayed the same reaction as Harley. Just as they tried struggling though, a ray of light shined upon them. Looking ahead, they saw two beings standing in a doorway. Before they could cheer, their smiles quickly dropped as these shadowy figures closed the doorway behind them. Who ever these guys were, they weren’t the rescue team.

“Hello ladies.”



*Later that night



Within the confines of Gotham city loomed a building that served little purpose these days, Police Headquarters. Still, even with the plummet in crime, this place stayed open, and now it was fortunate that it had, as Police Commissioner Jim Gordon had learned less than twenty minutes ago.

"I want check points on a twenty mile radius from that Adams Street alley and extending in all directions. Go to O'niel Drive if you have to. Choppers in the air with infared scopes, and a door to door check of every possible hideout within fifty miles." he told his officers. Just when he was joking about having the easiest job in the world these days, the biggest case to ever hit Gotham, or the world had just been handed to him, and to make things even more drastic, this was a personal one.

"Montoya, Bullock, you find out anything from that video at the museum?" he asked the two detectives among the cops.
"Nothing much. All we know is that he stole this one statue, but other than that, we can't figure out who this guy is. Even Bird Boy is stumped." Bullock pointed out.
"Well I don't care who he is. He's criminal and he can be caught just like all the others who came before him. Come on people, a guy in a weird mask with two 400 pound women and Posion Ivy can't be hard to spot. I want Batgirl found, and I want her found now!" Gordon ordered.
"Don't worry sir, we're on it." an officer said.
"Then why are you still standing here talking to me?" Gordon asked poking the officer in the chest. After that, they all moved out.

"This serious, what if that guy comes after the Batman?" one of the officers said to Bullock.
"It's just 'Batman', Bernett, there's no 'the'. That just sounds stupid." Bullock pointed out before walking off.
"It does not...does it?" Bernett wondered.

Meanwhile in his office, Jim Gordon breathed heavily before sitting down in his chair. Somewhere she was out there, helpless. The very women who literally took a bite out of Gotham's crime rate, and now she'd been kidnapped. No matter how it happened, Gordon blamed himself.
What kind of father was he?

"Hello Jim."
"AAH!" apparently one who still jumped when strange people wearing masks came out of the shadows.
"Do you poeple always have to do that?!" he yelled. The few cops that were left in the building looked back to his door when they heard that. Meanwhile, Batman wasn't sure what he could say. Fortunately, Gordon was able to calm himself down.

"I'm sorry, I shouldn't have snapped at you Bruce." he said sitting back down. Last year, while The Caped Crusaders still kept their identities secret, Barbara had decided she wanted to tell her father the truth. Partly because it felt right to now put him the loop, and partly because she was tired of having to slim down to a size three when ever she was around her dad or anyone else, and wanted to be able to just come home and lounge around in all her fatty glory. At least until she got her own place.

"It's alright Jim, I know you're worried about Barbara." Batman said, placing his hand on his old friend's shoulder. As it turned out, Gordon had known for quite some time now that Barbara was Batgirl, and while he couldn't confirm it, he suspected that Batman must be Bruce Wayne.
Knowing that his daughter was in the hands of the richest and most powerful man in Gotham City put him at ease, and he knew fully well how capable Barbara was. Now she was even the head of the most powerful group of superheroes in the world, and the fact that one man had abducted her terrified him.

"We all are."
"AAH!" a third party came into the conversation when Robin finally emerged from the shadows. Rather than wondering why he'd been hiding this whole time, or how he stayed hidden in that bright red and green costume of his, Gordon just muttered "I need a pacemaker."

"I've already got every available officer on this case, but I'm hoping you two already came across something." Gordon said.
"Not much." Robin hated to admit. The only people outside of this room that cared for Barbara more was Harley and Ivy, and they were gone to. All he wanted to do was start squeezing information out of any creep still left wandering the streets, but he knew they had to assess what they knew so far before deciding the next move.
The Comissioner deserved that much at least.

"We went down to the area where Zatanna said they had gone to. We searched every block, until we came across this one alley. There was something odd about the ground." Batman explained.
"What?" Gordon simply asked.
"Not sure, but I took a sample. I'll have to analyze it back at the cave." Batman said while holding up the test tube.

"Meanwhile while you're playing with mud, I'll be putting my own methods to good use." Robin spoke before cracking his knuckles. For once he thought his mentor's hunches were wrong. What could he possibly find out by analyzing concrete and dirt? That Gotham needed better paving?

What ever he was getting at, Robin decided to use a way of getting information that had worked so well for Batman. Fear. Sure he may not have a scary costume, but everyone knows who Robin is, and what he, and his friends are capable of.

Gordon was actually a little surprised by Tim's words. He expected him to as determined to find Batgirl as he and Bruce were, but right now he seemed more intimidating than Batman. Back in the old days he remembered all the rumors about Batgirl and Robin, both of them, but he knew that only his daughter and Dick Grayson went through puppy love once. Did Tim Drake have feelings for Barbara Gordon? The Comissioner wouldn't be surprised, his daughter was a wonderful girl, but she was a lot older than he was. Not that it mattered, he'd heard quite a lot about Robin and many league members, but lately he'd also heard that the Boy Wonder had started pursuing girls his own age.
Still, if that wasn't the case, then what was making him so hell bent?

"Robin, you know that won't get you anywhere," Batman said reaching for his shoulder.
"Says you!" his former sidekick then swiftly turned and glared at the Dark Knight before speaking again in a slightly calmer voice.
"Look Batman, we may be working on the same case, but I am not you're sidekick anymore. I don't have to follow your orders or examples. I do things my way because I'm my own man now, I have my own team, and I know how to be a hero. You may have been my mentor, but that doesn't mean I have to be like you." he finished. It was bad enough that he blamed himself for Batgirl's condition, but because of that, everything, like the annoying talk that even as Batman's former sidekick he should fall in like one of his little soldiers pissed him off.
He left through the window afterwards, leaving Batman and Gordon to watch the blinds flutter.

"To be fair, he's A-LOT like you. Honestly I'm surprised you didn't call him Batboy." the Comissioner cut the tension with a joke. All Batman did in response was just stare back in Robin's direction.

1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
As gun shots pierced the silence of the night and fires blazed through the darkness, Gotham city was tearing itself apart through madness. With every officer in the city searching for Batgirl, it hadn’t taken long for the news of her disappearance to get around, and as a result, every pit pocket and purse snatcher left over from league’s eating spree had finally crawled out from underneath their rocks, and many other people had gotten stupid and decided to give the crime thing a try. Whether looting television sets out of a display window, busting open an ATM machine, or killing someone they hated, the criminal element was back in Gotham City once again.

One such unfortunate soul was currently running from his life. One minute he had more cash than he had ever seen, then the next, a certain masked hero was after him. Like any stupid punk, he mistakenly ran into a dark alleyway. Sure this one wasn’t a dead end, but when he stopped in this court to catch his breath, a shadow with pointy ears came upon one of the apartment buildings.

“No!” he yelled, and out of fear he pulled out his gun. Before he even had a chance to pull the trigger though, a trademark rope wrapped around him and he tumbled to the ground. Looking behind him, he saw the expected sidekick, Robin the boy wonder, in the glow of the moonlight. Gulping, he looked back in front of him, where the figure had stepped out of the shadows, revealing a rather hungry cat.

Catwoman grabbed the extra robe and the crook gave out a brief shriek as he was hoisted into the air. The last thing he saw was the inside of her maw as she opened wide enough to fit all of him into her mouth and down her throat. After one mighty gulp, her belly jiggled and she spit out the birdarang end from her side.

“Thanks for dinner.” She smiled, only to receive no happy expression from her lover’s former partner in crime fighting.
“Any news from Batman?” Robin asked. He had no time to crack jokes, this was far too serious.

“He and Nightwing have got Gotham’s south side covered. Wild Cat, Metamorpho, J’onn, and Green Arrow joined up with them a few minutes ago.” Catwoman answered. She had been used to this kind of attitude from Bruce back in the old days, but she had never seen Robin like this. Sure the two of them were never exactly friends back then, but now she liked the bird boy and his cheery attitude and hoped that might someday lead to the two of them finally getting it on.
Sure she had Batman, but that didn’t mean she didn’t at least want a taste of Robin.

“Well while they’re watching each other’s backs, one of them should be watching Ollie.” Robin scowled. He still hadn’t forgiven Green Arrow for what he did to Starfire. Catwoman knew it would take time for the two of them to be in the same room together, but just the he said that so coldly, it sent shivers up her spine.

Soon the two of them returned to their mission with the others. With all of Gotham tearing itself apart, Batman had contacted the Teen Titans and some league members to help him take back the city. The only one he hadn’t been able to get was Wonder Woman, but she was involved in the search like the rest of league. Not to mention that with the big three gone and with Zatanna on the ground, she was the first choice to lead the FJL.
Batman had left Robin and Catwoman in charge of the others and they were now meeting them to get a progress report.

Atop a building near Police HQ, where the Bat Signal once again shined through the clouds, the heroes conversed.
“There are some things you can always count on. With Gotham City, it’s crime *BURP!*” Black Canary spoke solemnly. She knew how bad things were now, and it was depressing to think that just yesterday the citizens of this city might as well have been living in Metropolis. The only comfort she had was that all this was keeping her belly full as five guys were digesting inside her.

“We’ll have to focus on certain areas if we really want to get things under control. Black Canary, I’m putting you with Cheetah.” While she grew rounder, Robin was commanding the group. He figured that they were spreading themselves too thin, and nothing about these girls should never be thin. Not too mention that Cheetah, who Raven finally remembered to bring back to life with her powers was itching for some more action.

“What?! The last time I saw her she was just sitting on her fat ass and stuffing her face.” Cheetah complained.
“Newsflash, that’s what we do. Besides, you’re just mad because I snatched that one gangster from you. From how you were acting, it looked like you would have torn him to pieces if I hadn’t. I didn’t know you were into the hard stuff.” Canary responded.
“Enough!” Catwoman spoke for both Robin and herself. They couldn’t have league members bickering over food at a time like this.
“Alright,” Cheetah sighed and accepted her new partner, but as soon as the two of them walked off she mumbled behind her “but this cat’s going to get the stuffed canary later.”

“How long do you think until those creeps down to realize they can’t win?” Catwoman asked Robin.
“I think the real question is, why are all of us on the field?” speaking with no visible mouth, The Question spoke up. Standing next to his girlfriend Huntress, the conspiracy buff was trying to point out that he could be more helpful elsewhere.

“Q’s right Robin. He’s got a mean left hook, but we should have at least one person trying to figure out where Batgirl and the others are. Plus, his brain is probably as big as yours.” The hefty heroine agreed with her man. Robin had been so adamant to find the big three, but when Gotham suddenly went nuts, his old instinct to protect it kicked in. Fortunately though, her words did not go unheard by Robin.

“Alright. Question, I’m counting on you to find the pieces of this puzzle.” He said. The Question was gratified, just as eager as anyone else here to find out what could have gotten Batgirl, Harley Quinn and Poison Ivy. Also, he knew Slade was involved, but even now he could see this was too much for one man, even one as intelligent as he appeared to be. Someone was behind the scenes pulling at the strings of this powerful individual. They always are.
“Watch Tower,” and with that, the Question was teleported aboard.

“Huntress, you’re with Zatanna and Katana.” Robin ordered. The two of them nodded and the accomplished ninja quickly stood beside them. Katana was round all over, feeling no need to hide what she had to show off of all the criminal scum she had removed from the world. Without her costume, she would have looked like a giant ball of fat. Instead however, her uniform, consisting of the same red latex the old one was made of, was tightly stretched over her breasts huge backside and thighs, squeezing them and causing the many rolls to ooze over the fabric. Even at her size she still wished to remain as stealthy as possible, and the constant rubbing of her thighs or her giant jugs smacking together made too much noise. She still carried her sword, but that was only used for stripping her meal before consumption.
The three then left with a wave of Zatanna’s wand.

“At least I can still do some things right.” Robin told himself.
“Robin,” he swerved to see Starfire, the rest of the Titans, and Catwoman still there. Realizing he said that out loud, he slapped himself on the forehead.

“Man, you can’t blame yourself for what’s happened.” Cyborg pointed out. Everybody was worried about what had happened, but Robin was carrying the entire weight of the situation on his shoulders, and it was up to them to snap him out of it.

“They’re my friends, my really close friends, I should have at least noticed when Batgirl left the party.” Robin pointed out.
“Kicking yourself won’t solve anything. The only way you’ll get through this is to realize you’re not in this alone and direct that anger at Slade where it belongs.” Raven then pointed out, speaking for the first time in a few days with that cold tone to her raspy voice. She cared for Robin, but she hated seeing someone moping around about something when they could be fixing it.
Unfortunately, her words to just washed over Robin.
Common sense didn’t work, the harsh truth didn’t either, so it was time for the sympathetic approach.

“Robin, I will admit that I cannot imagine how much you care for the Batgirl, Harlequin or even Poison Ivy, but I do know what it means to be worried about a loved one and-“
“It’s my fault.” Robin interrupted Starfire, finally deciding to get all of his feelings out in the open, hoping that would make everyone stop talking in the process.

“It’s my fault, I let Slade confuse me, manipulate me, and he got away. He’s not like Two Face or the Scarecrow or even the Joker, he’s something much worse, but I can’t let anyone pay for my mistakes.” Robin told everyone. Of all the terrible situations he had been thrown into since first wearing this mask, this was the most dire, and the fact that he was even partly responsible made him feel like this was all his fault.

“Robin, you can’t blame yourself. Batgirl, Harely, Ivy, they chose this life just like the rest of us. They know the risks.” Catwoman responded, being as sympathetic as possible. Ever since marrying Bruce, she had really come to like and respect Tim. Even before then she openly tried, knowing that he was like a son to him. Sure she knew she couldn’t act like his mother. More like a concerned foster parent who just wanted to see the kid smile again.

“How long before I let someone else I care about down? Batman, Nightwing, the three of you.” Robin asked them. Three of the most important people in his life were gone, he could not handle losing anymore.
He hated having his team see him like this.

Speaking of his team, Terra then stepped forward and took her shot at cheering him up.
“Look Robin, I know I just showed up, but I’ve traveled a lot and seen real heroes in action more than once, and you’ve got some grade A ones right here with you.” Before she continued, Terra turned her pudgy head to beast Boy and smiled at him. He blushed, but then looked at his leader firmly and nodded.

Terra then continued and placed her hand on Robin’s shoulder, holding him close. Raven noticed that, but didn’t say anything, hoping someone would finally get through to the brooding hero.

“These guys are your friends Robin, and from what I’ve seen you really care about your friends. They’re here for you, and I have no doubt that all of us heroes combined will be able to find Batgirl, Harley and Ivy, and really kick the crap out of Slade.” She finished. Finally, she managed to do what no one else had until now, she got Robin to smile, and as a result, everyone else did.

“Thanks Terra.” Robin said.
“No problem.” She said. Suddenly everyone else just swarmed around him, some with hopeful words, and some with hugs and eager hands. In the midst of all that, Terra managed to slip away down to ground level and into an alleyway.

“Here’s what I really think *BOOOOOORRRRRRRRRPPPPP!* “ Terra scoffed as ripped a nasty one. She grinned and actually sniffed her own putrid gas. Earlier she had apologized to the Titans for cutting the cheese with them in the same room, but that little ramble was only because she didn’t want to do that was because she wanted to retain the image of sweet and innocent girl. In reality, Terra was never ashamed of her farts, and was always anxious to blast the butt trumpet loud and proud.

She told Robin that she and the others would do everything in their power to help him, but in reality, Terra couldn’t give a rat’s ass about Batgirl or those two other sluts. Rather than being on a wild goose chase, she’d much rather mount him and then fart him into submission. Sure she could easily knock him out with a few rocks, but trapping him underneath her sexy but deadly ass sounded a lot more fun.

Suddenly, she heard some weird jingle from above.
“Terra, top side!” Robin ordered. She then made an earth pillar and got back up to the roof. Once there, she saw Robin looking at his communicator, while Cyborg had a flashing light on his arm, Beast Boy had one on his belt, Raven had one on the button on her cape, and Starfire was looking to see if her skimpy costume had one.
“Okay, why is everyone blinking?” Terra asked.

Robin understood what the lights meant. They were a signal he invented for his teammates, so if they were away when trouble came around, this signal would tell them something was. In this case, it seemed to work, as Robin’s locator detected something happening in Jump City.
“Looks like someone’s been busy while you were away.” He said.

At first Robin had come off like an incredible jerk for what he said to Star, but now he had just spoken like a true hero. “Leave me alone,” Raven emotionlessly said in a vain attempt to escape from the new pain that had come to her life. The magic she felt from them was weak and she could take them in a fight if she wanted to, but she was not in the mood for this today. She wanted to forget her problems, not look them in the face and take them on in a fight. They moved closer, uncaring about what she wanted, until she could smell the brimstone coming off them. They were fresh from Hell, probably looking to start something with the daughter of Trigon and earn some respect down below. But if they thought for one second that the human blood in her made her helpless, they were in for a rude awakening. Raven rose slowly, clenching her chubby hands tightly and making dark energy crackle around her knuckles. Maybe hurting someone would help her feel better about herself.

“Oh my, I think we’ve upset her,” the male demon said in mock horror. “I so ever hope she isn’t too angry to hear what we have to say. It’s not everyday you get offered your hearts desire.”

“What?” Raven softly said and turned to see the demons for the first time. They looked almost human, no red skin or pointy teeth, but even if Raven ignored the wings and horns on their heads she’d know they were demons. The sick energy of Hell wafted from them, anyone with any since of magic could sense these beings were children of Lilith. Raven stared at them, they showed no fear or hostility; only a calm façade that would put most to ease. Raven wasn’t like most, she didn’t drop her guard for a second as they spoke.
“You heard my brother, we are here to give you your hearts desire,” the woman demon explained and reached over to place her hand on Raven’s shoulder. She backed away from the demon’s touch, not trusting these things to lay a hand on her. She smiled, gracious even when being looked at with mistrust. “I am Juliet and this is my brother Romeo. You have nothing to fear from us, we come only looking to talk about a opportunity that we think you might be interested in. We have been watching you and have seen how your lovers have toyed with your feelings. You seek something deeper, but they only care about the pleasures of the flesh. The ones you love see you only as a toy of pleasure. It is such a sad tale that even Lucifer would cry to hear it.”

Romeo stepped forward, looking at Raven with only compassion and love. He was handsome and for an instant Raven was able to forget he was a demon as she stared into his deep brown eyes. “We have seen your sadness and want to help. The universe is changing and you can change with it. Help us make thing right again. The heroes have been seduced by sins of the flesh and absolute justice; the line between good and evil has been crossed when the heroes of your world started consuming those they deemed evil. It is wrong, but we will fix it. Using one of their own sinful batch, we will change everything and set everything right again.”

“One of their own,” Raven repeated, narrowing her eyes at the demon siblings. “Are you talking about Harley and Batgirl?”

“Yes. We are using them as the catalyst to a better world. Daughter of Trigon, we will soon be able to change the world, make you whole and purge the sin from your lovers heart. We can recreate the world where your first love Robin’s love will be pure and unchallenged and your closest friend Starfire will be your sister in all but blood. Don’t say that isn’t tempting. Don’t say you won’t help us redeem the children of Lilith and help build a better world. Look into your heart and find the human part of it that says what we say is right!” Romeo exclaimed, tears of passion forming in the corners of his eyes. He looked so strong, but sad, like a tragic hero with the world on her shoulder. His sister didn’t look much better, her eyes were so deep with sorrow, like she wanted to be good but was unable to. These demons looked like sad souls, looking to redeem themselves.

“You know what I think?” Raven began to say. Anyone would be moved by their plight and at least listen to more. They were very convincing and even Batman might have believed their words were sincere. However, Raven knew better. “I think…. YOU ARE BOTH FULL OF SHIT!”

Raven rose from the ground, hovering several feet up as dark energy crackled from her fists. Romeo and Juliet backed away as Raven looked down at them without any compassion. “Sweet words from demons are like sweetened poison, It seems good at first but it eventually kills you. You could tell me about your good intentions all day and I’d still see the lie behind everything you say. The only reason I didn’t blow you back to Hell was to find out if you had anything to do with Robin’s friends disappearance. Now that I know you’re involved, you’re going to take me to them, or I’m going to send you back to the fire in pieces.”

Raven loved Robin. She couldn’t deny that and she wanted so badly to have the life the demons told her about. She didn’t need sex or her fat to be happy, only Robin. But she knew what they promised her was a lie and even if it wasn’t, making a deal with them wasn’t worth it. To make deal with a demon damned the soul of not only the one making the deal but those close to them as well. Raven was ready to face he flames when she died, but she would die a thousand deaths before letting Robin suffer her eventual fate. Never compromise with demons, even for your hearts desire.

The demons stared at Raven with surprise, but slowly their expressions shifted into looks of annoyance. They didn’t look frightened or angry, just annoyed at Raven’s rejection of their offer. Romeo sneered at Raven, no longer looking like a dashing, honourable demon, and turned to his sister. “I told you the cunt wouldn’t go for it? Even a filthy spawn of Trigon isn’t stupid enough to trust us.”

“But we had to try and get the stupid cunt on our side,” Juliet sighed and shook her head in disappointment. “The cunt might be garbage, but she could have been useful garbage. How was I to know the fat cunt had half a brain?”

Raven had heard enough. She didn’t need to hear these monster insult her. She pointed her open hand at them and let her dark energy shot out at them. Let the demons taste what her father’s curse had given her. The energy crackled towards them, but before it could hit, a figure ran out between the demon’s and the blast and blocked it with his sword. Energy sparked against the steel and Raven looked at the person that had gotten in her way with a growing feeling of dread in her round belly. Her attack dissipated and the man lowered his sword.
