Raven stared defiantly into the one good eye of Deathstroke the Terminator, refusing to back down, even in the face of her team’s ultimate enemy.

Romeo and Juliet cackled at the expression on Raven’s face. “We anticipated that you’d refuse our offer and invite someone that can appreciate a good offer when they hear it. If it make you feel any better, at least now you won’t have to worry about anything ever again.” The demons disappeared, back to their home to watch the slaughter.

Deathstroke advanced; behind him, a fat girl with pink hair appeared and joined him. Jinx had joined the fight and Raven’s luck had just gotten worse. Against Slade she stood a tiny chance, but two super villains were too much. With nowhere to run, Raven prepared herself for the fight of her life. She hated her life right now, but that didn’t mean that she would ever give up and let these monster’s win. She’d fight to her last breath and take comfort in one thing, she had found love.
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: Tempting Offer

1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
Suddenly, a bird-a-rang came flying from behind the two villains as they advanced on Raven, and it struck Slade’s hand. Upon seeing him lose his sword, like an idiot, Jinx didn’t know whether or not to be happy about this. The two then turned to see the Teen Titans had arrived on the scene, along with Batman and Catwoman. In the front of the group, Robin was holding his team’s communicator which still blinked with Raven’s signal. He popped it back into his belt and shouted “Titans, GO!”

Everyone charged at the villains, but while Deathstroke stood his ground, Jinx wisely did a cartwheel and got out of the way. However, this caused Cyborg to immediately break away from the pack. Deathstroke was a big threat, but the big, fat threat had pissed him off the most right now.

Just before the others reached Slade, Catwoman let out a feral cry as she leaped at the psychopath. Aside from the gravity defying sight of someone that huge flying through the air, along with two giant moons eclipsing the sun, Deathstroke seemed to disappear beneath a ton of feline blubber as she landed with a ground shaking thud. The angry mob of heroes quickly came to a screeching halt, and even Raven was left with her wide jaw on the floor. While everyone else was left speechless, just moved wiggled her gelatinous form on top of their foe and smiled “Meow.”

Then, any decision as to who got to enjoy the Slade pancake was put on hold as her body began wobbling even more. She could feel the madman moving beneath, and at first paid no mind to it as no one but a special few had been able to wiggle their way out from beneath her, and even they only rarely escaped her lusciously fat body. It seemed though that Slade wasn’t in to squashing as Catwoman suddenly felt herself being lifted off the ground!

Our heroes were left speechless once more as they saw Slade rising back up onto his feet with the fat cat now over his head. His hands disappeared into her costume and the many layers of flab contained within it, but he was still holding solid. As if this wasn’t terrifying enough, it was then that Robin and the others saw something glow on Slade’s forehead. As red as the fire’s of hell, the pentagram appeared between his eyes, and he hurled Catwoman at the Titans, now squashing them under the crushing weight.

“Azareth, Metrion, Zinthos!” unfortunately for Slade, he hadn’t hit the only Titan that was still behind him, and she sent her dark right towards him. It enveloped Deathstroke’s torso and Raven flung him into the air, before bringing him back down to Earth. With a sickening thud he was crushed into the ground, once, twice, but not the third time as within Raven’s energy field, his hands soon glowed with flames. With a fiery burst he broke free, and launched the blaze at Raven in midair. She encompassed a force field around herself, but fought to keep it from breaking apart.

As Batman and Robin helped Catwoman get off the others, Starfire was the first one to get free, and gasped when she saw Raven. Rage burned with her green eyes as she launched her own energy blast at the Terminator. As he started to close in on Raven, and as she was falling to her knees, Slade’s onslaught finally ended as he was hit in the back.

As he screamed in agony, Robin rushed to Raven’s side. Just as he reached her, Slade managed to form a pillar of flames around him which blocked Starfire’s eye blast. Once he stopped and stood within the ring of scorched Earth, she tried firing a starbolt, but he caught it in his flames and fired it right back at her. This sent Starfire flying back right towards Batman and Catwoman, but while the Dark Knight was able to leap up and out of the path of danger, the orange cannonball struck Catwoman right in the gut and made it so deep it knocked the wind out of her. As she toppled to the ground, upon impact, he belly rolls promptly shot Starfire back out, only to have the alien girl belly flop back onto her own, leaving both heroines to groan as they collapsed on each other.

While that happened, Batman had tossed some ice capsules at Deathstroke. He just stood there as those things hit him and sealed him within the ice. Unfortunately, he just came bursting out it just as the Dark Knight landed on his feet. Thankfully, Batman was able to land a few solid punches to his head, just before Deathstroke kneed him in the stomach, before literally flicking him on the forehead and sending him flying back twenty feet!

While all this was going on, Cyborg was going one on one with Jinx. Constantly he was trying to land a fist on the big target, and constantly she was leaping out of the way. Sometimes, she fired her bad luck spells, and every time they hit the ground, it’d cave in beneath Cyborg’s feet, and every time he’d just barely leap to safety. During that, Jinx fired more blasts at him. The sooner she got him in her belly, the sooner this would all be over.

Cyborg would just barely rolled out of the way, but he then fired his sonic cannon at her, sending Jinx flying. She landed with a loud thud, groaning as her fat only provided her with some cushioning. Sick of this fight already, Jinx started losing it with anger and started swinging her fists like a crazy girl. Cyborg just held up his palms to block the blows, looking both disgusted and annoyed at the sight before him.

“You just had to go back to Slade.” He said, only inciting even more furious attacks. “He’s the Terminator! I’d be an idiot to keep on running! I DIDN’T HAVE A CHOICE!” Jinx screamed at him, to which promptly held his cannon once more in her face, said “We’ve all got a choice,” and fired.

With Batman now taken out of the fight, it was then that Terra and Beast Boy finally managed to get back on their feet and took their turn against the super powered mastermind. Morphing into a hawk, Beast Boy made a bee line for Slade, and before he could get a beat on the fast animal, he got his mask clawed at. Being made of metal, the scratches were nothing but an annoyance, but it was the perfect distraction so he wouldn’t see several stones heading right for the joints in his arms and legs. Deathstroke cried in pain, thus allowing Beast Boy to turn into a python and capture him within his coils. Even as he got the life squeezed out of him though, rather than calling upon the fires of hell once more, Slade asked a very obvious question even while gasping for breath.

“What do you think you’re doing?” his question was directed only at Terra, who stared at the mad man within the grasp of the boy who loved her. She came up to this manipulator and killer of so many, looked at him through the blue lenses in her goggles and told him “I won’t let you hurt my friends.” She felt imposing as she met him face to face, but all Slade did was scoff “Dear child, you don’t have any friends.”

His eyes blazed once more as he spoke, making Terra gasp. She then watched as Slade’s supernatural strength tore Beast Boy off of him, causing him to turn back to normal, and allowing Slade to grab his leg before he hit the ground, and once more he used a Titan like a projectile. Terra was able to take off on a boulder and catch him, but that allowed Slade to fire another heat blast that obliterated the rock and sent them both tumbling to the ground. As they felt jagged stones break their fall, Beast Boy and Terra were soon in each other’s arms as they saw Deathstroke approach them.

“HIYAH!!!” he only had time to turn as his skull was struck by a metal bow staff. As he stumbled, Robin jabbed his opponent in the side violently over and over. He then swept the villains feet, sending him to the ground and allowing Robin to viciously hit him in the head again. The still conscious Titans heard a loud crack as his mask nearly split in half, and they could only watch as Robin kept his staff firmly on Slade’s chest.

“Robin, that was vicious, dishonorable and ruthless. Excellent, there may still be hope for you yet.” Slade told him, to which the boy wonder bluntly responded “Where did you get your powers?” Scowling through his mask, Deathstroke saw that Robin still needed some convincing to walk away from playing costumed hero.

“I’m sure your precious Raven will fill you in once she wakes up. That is, if she wakes up.” Robin’s eyes widened. He realized that upon seeing that Raven would be okay, she was still unconscious and he had left her defenseless. Well, no matter what, he wasn’t going to let this psycho lay one hand on one of the girl he loved.

However, upon simply holding his hand straight up, Deathstroke launched another fiery blast into the air. Suddenly, it changed directions and headed straight for Raven! Robin immediately rushed towards her, leaving Slade to wonder if he’d end up losing his future apprentice, and leaving Robin unsure if he’d make it in time.

BOOM!

Suddenly, what sounded like an explosion came in the form of a bright flash and a force powerful enough to extinguish the flames. Everyone left in the fight, and even the ones who got knocked out, especially Raven, just stared in awe as before them, or right behind them was something only some of them recognized, a Boom Tube.

Then, rather than the New Gods or Darkseid walking into the fight, the first thing they saw was a…Batarang? It didn’t look like any model Robin had ever seen, but he wasn’t complaining when it struck Slade in the chest, remained caught in his costume, and then electrocuted him!

Three figures then came bolting out of the portal. They moved so fast, and they all headed for Deathstroke. Blow after blow was exchanged as they pulverized the stunned villain. Slade had his work cut out for him, as not only were three new heroes taking him down, but two of them were both hugely fat, and hugely strong, while the third was moving so swiftly, it was unbelievable. A claw strike here, a green energy blast there, and all in extreme close-ups left our heroes perplexed. One of the fat ones eventually did throw a green energy shot at Jinx, catching both her and Cyborg off guard.

At last though, Slade shook away the onslaught by using his powers to fire himself into the air and towards his henchgirl. Before anyone could do anything, he grabbed Jinx by the arm and the two were soon engulfed in a pillar of flames, and once it was gone, so were they.

The battlefield became silent, as everyone took in the sight of the three that had saved them. One of them was a teenaged girl wearing a cheetah print cat suit, complete with a mask and tiny, pointy cat ears. She was big to, not fat, but seriously chubby. She had thick arms and even thicker legs, with her suit clinging to her thighs like a second skin. That was even truer for her torso. Her belly was tightly packed into her costume, its abundant rolls squished together to give it a perfectly round shape as it hung just above her crotch. Resting on top was set of Double D’s. As expected from her legs, her hips were nicely thick and her waist was wide, and her ass was almost as big as her belly. The curvature of each cheek was outlined by her costume. Her puffy cheeks also destroyed any feral image the cat could have had, as they made her look more like a chipmunk, but every hero here knew the power of even a chubby, costumed woman.

Standing beside her was a real whale of a woman. Who ever she was, she looked more like she was eighteen. Her black hair was so long, Starfire would be asking her for showering tips. She had creamy skin, and eyes with no pupils that glowed green. A purple headband with a star on it was on her forehead, and just below her cherubic face was another purple band that wrapped around her neck. Her costume was composed of a purple leotard with long sleeves, a V hole exposing her chest, and it stopped in between her legs. Like the cheetah girl, this costume got everyone looking at it either hard or wet. As said before, this woman was humongous, with thighs as thick as Batman’s waist, arms and legs that were pillars of flab, and G cup breasts that filled up the whole opening in her leotard. Her belly was a blob just like she was, and the back of her costume disappeared completely within the crack of her butt, with each cheek the size of three watermelons.

Finally, there was the only skinny, and only male member of the team, and as amazing as it might sound, he actually shocked our heroes more so than the ladies. Why? He looked like Batman! Seriously, standing before them was a guy in an all black Batman costume, and this one wasn’t even in any of the movies. Aside from the pointy ears and arm blades on his gloves, the only distinguishing features was a redesigned, red Batman symbol and a built in utility belt. He was skinnier than the real Batman, but that didn’t make the shock go away.

“Who are you?” Batman finally questioned. He didn’t know who these people were or where they had come from, although he suspected Darkseid might be involved what with them coming out of a Boom Tube. Those three may have beaten Deathstroke, but the Dark Knight wasn’t going to let them leave without some answers. The one dressed like a cat stepped up and spoke “I’m Catgirl, and we’re from the future, and I’d figured you’d have that much figured out by now…dad.”

Everyone gasped, and Batman nearly keeled over. They watched as the girl pushed her mask off, showing off not only her short, dark hair, but Bruce’s cold blue eyes. “Carry Kelley Wayne at your service.” She actually bowed before her audience. She played it off like a cool cat, but it was all a defense mechanism, as Carry was fighting the urge to either hug or cry at the sight of past versions of her long dead parents.

As Batman and Catwoman were left with matching slacked jaws, the fatter girl then spoke up “Look, I know this is confusing, but it’s better if you know to move things along. Robin, Starfire, my name is Nightstar, and I’m your daughter.” This naturally left the Tameranian princess and her human lover just as wide eyed and slack jawed as Robin’s foster parents as they were just introduced to their future offspring. Their minds were blank, but Beast Boy managed to slide over and say “Okay, I know this is a huge WTF moment, but dude, you made one good looking kid.” That caused Raven to suddenly appear beside her awe struck lovers, wipe the shock off her face, and promptly slap Beast Boy, who then stumbled into Terra, who did the same thing.

Somehow, Batman was able to divert his attention away from the girl who just called herself his daughter, and looked at the man dressed like him, as he was just staring off into space next to him. “And who’s-“ Batman tried to reach out to the other Batman, but the other Batman grabbed his arm and Judo flipped him onto the ground. The next thing Bruce knew, he was pulled by the scruff of his own logo up to the face of the Tomorrow Knight who told him “I’m Batman.”

That got everyone’s attention, not for what was said, but for how it sounded. The other Batman spoke in a fake voice, a trait not uncommon to Batman, but the way he talked sounded so ridiculous. It was so gruff and grainy, it sounded more like he had lung cancer.

“Uh, what’s with his voice?” Beat Boy asked, now sporting matching hand prints on both cheeks. At that point, the other Batman realized just what he was doing, and let the present’s Caped Crusader go. As he got up, he watched as the other Batman reached into his belt, pulled out a pill, and popped it into his mouth.

“He’s been recovering from a cold.” Nightstar explained. “But who is he?” Starfire asked her…it felt beyond weird for her to think this word…daughter. As everyone looked at the other Batman, and Raven made a disturbing note that no one here claimed to be mothered by her, B2 realized he had yet to truly reveal himself to everyone. Putting aside his old instincts, he pulled off his mask, and immediately, Bruce Wayne recognized him.

“Tim.” Yes, standing before everyone was an adult version of Tim Drake. If possible, this received the loudest gasp of all. Anyone who knew him now recognized the face, but at the same time, the gel-less hair and grimacing scowl made him nearly unrecognizable. Somehow, everyone was able to look behind them, at the Tim Drake they knew, who couldn’t believe what he was seeing.
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: SURPRISE!!!!

choices: Catch all that? Well then keep following the heroes
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
“Robin?” Raven said for the third time. After being frozen like a statue for thirty seconds, she and Starfire has hovered over to his sides. It had been a little hard for Starfire to move away from her future daughter for the future father of her child, but it helped that Nightstar stayed behind. She wanted to be there for the past version of her dad, but knew that approaching him in any way right now would only make things worse. Meanwhile, Raven waved her flabby hand in front of Robin’s face and Starfire snapped her fingers before him.

Finally the girls got a response from their lover. They watched as he picked his jaw off the floor and slowly lowered his head. Now staring at the dirt beneath his feet, everyone waited heatedly to see if there was more. At last they heard him utter a single word “Batman…” Then, they saw slowly look back up, and back at his future self “What would ever make me want to be Batman?”

Everyone’s head turned back to his direction. Even if the identities of Nightstar or Catgirl were still in question, there was no doubt that the man in the all black batsuit was Tim Drake. His face and eyes were both the same, only older. The only difference was that his hair was now matted down and stuck out at the sides, with no sign of hair gel. The attention didn’t affect him in any way as the classic Batman scowl was present on his face. He did however stop being silent and answered Robin’s question.

“If you knew everything I have gone through, you’d understand. The world we come from, is a nightmare,” he began. He sighed as he dug up some painful memories, and his daughter and ward felt for him. Once more, he spoke “Our future is a hell on Earth. We went on this same mission you are about to. We thought we could handle things, never even imagining that Harley and Barbara lied within the bowels of hell itself. We fought for our very lives, and soon discovered that two demons named Romeo and Juliet planned to use the Urn of Gluttony to Batgirl and Harley, and sick them on the world. As they triggered the spell however, Raven desperately tried to both reverse it and contain the magic. She thought she could handle its power…she was wrong. At night I can still hear her screams as the power overwhelmed her and bloated her body until she exploded. If not for the portal that Romeo and Juliet made to escape, we would have all perished that day. Raven died, Cyborg and Beast Boy and Terra were caught in the blast, and as if by some sick joke, we were spared as we escaped just in the nick of time. However, even with our lives, we soon witnessed what had just been unleashed upon the Earth. The explosion had created a permanent tear in space and time, forming a permanent gateway between the Earth and hell. Within seconds, demons came flying out in the hordes; we had no choice but to run. By the time we were able to get a hold of the others, it was too late. The portal had grown to engulf the city, and soon the entire world was engulfed in the fires of hell. Everywhere we looked, the sky was blood red, the only remaining buildings were ruins of the human race, and the world became frighteningly quiet, with only the shrieks and laughter of those monsters able to be heard, along with the constant cries of their victims. Only a small fraction of humanity is left. We’ve been forced underground, and my group is housed within the caverns beneath Wayne Manor. Every time we leave the bunkers we fight to take back the Earth, but in that future, I know we can’t win that war.”

His words left everyone, even the two girls that were from the future speechless. Everyone else could not believe that was the kind of future that Tim Drake had come from, one where evil ruled the world, and those three were the only heroes left alive, a literal hell on Earth.

“You said you lost some of the Titans on this very day, what about the rest of the league?” Catwoman asked. This was all too much, she didn’t want to believe that was the future everyone had to look forward to. She then saw Catgirl approach her, and for once, the nonchalant feline didn’t look so hot. She slipped her mask back on and sighed sadly “They were all killed one by one…you guys were the last ones.”

Once more, Catwoman was rendered speechless, and she just stared into the trembling eyes of Catgirl as she fought back tears. She had been told numerous times not to get attached to the past heroes, since it would interfere with the mission and that they weren’t yet the people her parents were when she was born. Besides, cats were supposed to be able to take nearly everything in stride, and that method of moving forward was the only thing that had kept her from going crazy these past six years. Selina had only met this girl a few minutes ago, but already she was beginning to feel the maternal need to comfort the child.

It was then that Batman stepped up. This all seemed impossible, even given the things he had seen and done, but he knew when someone was lying, and could tell that future Tim was the genuine article. Since it was clear he wouldn’t have a son, he approached the only person he’d be proud to have picked up his mantle.

“You say you can’t win the war, so you came back to the past to try and change the future.” He deduced. Batman Beyond nodded and responded “Exactly. Now if twenty questions are thru, all of you follow me to the portal to hell we actually want to see.” And so the future’s Batman headed off towards the city, recalling everything that lied before him. It took a minute, but eventually the rest of our heroes followed the man that had left them with more questions than answers. However, while everyone else was still trying to process everything, mainly that they were about to set foot into hell, Starfire, who was in the back of the group, felt someone tug on her shoulder. Raven had been right next to her, and she turned back to them.

“Listen, there’s something else you need to know. My dad didn’t want me to say anything, but it’s the only way you can save Tim Drake.” Nightstar told her. This naturally got both Starfire and Raven’s attention, but it left them both confused. The tubby Tameranian turned her head back to the future’s Batman and the three quickly made sure they didn’t fall behind, while still staying a short distance away from the rest of the group.

“I don’t understand, Rob-…you’re father is still alive.” Starfire quickly rephrased, still finding it hard to openly admit that she had a 21 year old daughter. Quickly though, Nightstar elaborated.

“I mean your Tim Drake. In the future, you always told me about how he was before he became Batman, and even I remember some of that, but everyday, since the apocalypse, we could both tell that he was smiling less and less every day. You told me that once the survivors settled in the bunkers, dad kind of broke down. Losing so many of his friends and teammates, evil ruling the world, it all hit him like a ton of bricks. Soon though, you said he was able to channel that sorrow into rage, and everyday he was out on the battlefields, taking down more demons than anyone. You liked that Robin wasn’t moping anymore, but even then you could tell that the man you fell in love with was so slowly fading away. However, that’s when I came along. Obviously you guys never planned on bringing a kid into a world like that, but even after Armageddon, everyone was still going at it like rabbits when they weren’t taking turns eating each other. On the day I was born, apparently dad had never smiled that big before. As the years passed, even with the kind of world I was born into, I was happy thanks to you guys. Even when I was being trained to fight and master my powers, the Tim Drake and Koriand’r that I knew loved me with all their hearts. A few years later, I got a sister of sorts when Catwoman had Carry. Seeing her folks training her to become Catgirl even inspired my dad to take in two other kids named Terry and Cassandra, and make them his sidekicks. He even let Cassandra have the honor of taking up the Batgirl mantle. But then, if you can believe it, things got worse.”



*Memory*
Every Gotham City thug and super criminal that was now free to roam the Earth again engulfed Batman and Catwoman, overwhelming them, while an injured Robin was carried away by a reluctant Starfire. After that, Robin came to see Carry, who was crying alone in her room as she clung tightly to her stuffed cheetah. He hugged her, doing his best to comfort her, but also relied on her for support. Later, just to prove it to himself, he held the tattered Cat and Bat cowls in his hands, and cried by himself as well.
*End of Memory*



“Even after everything that had happened, that hit him the hardest. It was like he lost his parents all over again. Even worse, the thought of a world without Batman terrified him more than anything. By the time he came around, he gave the Robin suit to Terry and never looked back.”

“Using all the resources at his disposal and that huge brain of his, dad constructed his own Bat suit. It was as thin as cloth, but on the inside is cybernetic armor that increases his strength and agility. Itching for revenge, he rallied everyone together for an assault on Gotham and everyone followed him. The battle was technically a victory, we sent plenty of those monsters back to the pit, but dad’s rage made him get sloppy, and three bullets from a possessed gun was all it took.”



*Memory*
BANG!
BANG!
BANG!

“NOOOO!!!!!!!!!!” Nightstar cried, but it was too late. She could only watch as her mother plummeted to the ground, landing with a sickening and earth cracking thud. Beside her were the new Robin and Batgirl, lying in pools of their own blood. Off to the side, her father, Batman, tried even more desperately to stand as he held his wounded shoulder. When he saw just who they were up against, he went into a blinding rage and tried to tear the guy limb from limb. Unfortunately, that also left him easy to manipulate and take down for a second while the enemy shattered even more of the psyche of the boy playing dress up by killing those three.

His laughter was as maniacal as they come, and the Joker couldn’t help but bask in the glory of the moment. It was absolutely hilarious to see Nightstar cradle mommy’s corpse in her arms. The biggest joke of all though, his horned employers had worked their magic on his weapon of choice, the gun that killed Thomas and Martha Wayne, so that it could take down anyone with one shot. He was busting a gut so hard, he didn’t even notice that he dropped the thing, only when someone pointed it at his forehead.

BANG!

Nightstar looked, only to see thankfully that she had not lost her father as well. However, a sickening feeling soon filled her insides at what she saw. Batman using a gun, even though it was on the man that had killed her mother and so many others, that looked wrong. Her father just stared coldly at the bloody corpse below him, until he walked back towards his daughter. He wound up walking right past her, and just told her to get up.
*End Memory*



“After that, it was like that costume consumed him. On that day, Tim Drake died as well. All that was left, was Batman.” Nighstar finished. Even Raven’s dark heart was horrified by what she’d just heard, and Starfire was near tears. The news of her eventual death wasn’t what upset her most of all though, but that Robin would be consumed by anger and violence and his heart would become stone cold. To ensure no one else noticed them, Nightstar left no room for her mom to compose herself.

“If we do change the future, I need to promise me that you will never let that happen to Tim okay? Even if he still becomes Batman, you cannot let the man you love, the man I know my father still is deep down disappear behind that mask.” She said. Starfire desperately tried to stop her tears, but soon felt a warm, soft arm wrap around her body. She looked to Raven, who told Nightstar “We won’t.”

Aside from making sure she didn’t wind up killing herself, Raven would be damned if she was going to let the man she loved be worse off than their Batman once was. As such, when they kept moving, Nightstar thought “Why do I get the feeling I’m going to wind up with a sibling after all this?”
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: Two very important conversations

choices: There is a welcoming party in Hell
they get separated quickly once in Hell
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
“You are sure this is the location the Poison Ivy gave you?” Robin asked for the third time since getting to the location where Ivy said she escaped from the hell dimension. They had all arrived here right after everything had been explained. Robin looked at Batman or should he say his Batman who isn’t him. It was all kind of confusing having himself and his future daughter here. Batman, his Batman, seemed not to be bothered by the fact that his daughter was standing a few feet away from him. Robin wish’s he knew how the Dark Knight did it.
“I’m sure, stop asking,” Batman growled and focused his mind on the mission at hand and not other things, like sidekicks taking up his legacy or daughters he never knew. It all had him flustered, not that he sawed it. Catwoman was another story. His love was trying to spend as much time with her future daughter, trying to find out everything from her favourite food to her favourite position. Also, she was critiquing the poor girl on how thin she was. Batman was sure that after they rescued Harley and Barbara, Selina was going to drag their future daughter back home and try to plump her up.

“I’m sorry, it’s just that the entrance to Hell being here is just…. Weird.” Robin stared at the abandoned building. Poison Ivy had said the doorway was inside and they couldn’t miss it if they followed the smell of brimstone. Still, having the entrance to Hell being located in an abandoned DMV was eerie.

“There are hundreds of different entrances to Hell Robin, this is just the only one we know about,” Batman responded coldly, checking over his nitrogen tablets as he got ready to go strait into Hell. He looked like he was just going for a walk through the park.

“If we had more time, we’d locate a doorway that the demons don’t know about. The element of surprise would come in useful,” spoke the other Batman as he loaded a pair of fresh batteries into a wicked looking taser. He looked as unconcerned as his predecessor.

“Agreed, but time is of the greatest importance now,” Batman told Future Batman as he loaded up a silver dagger blessed by the pope. Not a weapon he usually took with him, but one he kept prepared for just such an occasion.

“Agreed,” Future Batman said as he inspected his anti-demon bat spray. It was almost as good as the anti-shark bat spray Batman used to use in the old days.

Watching his future self talk with Batman was freaky for Robin, mostly because how alike they were. Same cold voice, same complete focus, same imposing presence. Tim had always wanted to be Batman, but now that he saw himself as him it just felt wrong. He was so distant and unhappy; he hadn’t said two words to his own daughter since arriving. Tim didn’t want to be that way, it wasn’t him.

“Kind of weird seeing yourself like that.” Robin turned around and saw Nightstar, his daughter, standing behind him with a sad smile. Robin hadn’t said much to his future child, unable to think of anything that he could tell her. Honestly, he was afraid to talk to her alone. This was his daughter, but he knew nothing about her. Did she hate him for what he had become or feel he was weak for not saving her mother. He didn’t know what to say.

“Don’t say anything, da…Tim. I just want to tell you something,” Nightstar told him nervously. Robin nodded, happy to say he wasn’t going to have to do any talking. Nightstar blushed as she looked at her father, biting her lip as she fought to say something. Finally, she grabbed him and crushed him to her chest in a full body hug. Robin’s head was buried between the giant breasts of his daughter as he strained to hear her voice over her blubbery body smothering him.

“I just wanted to tell you how happy I am to get to meet you before things got bad and I’m going to try my hardest to make sure you stay this way. I love you dad and want you to be happy. That’s all.” Nightstar broke her hug and quickly walked away, happy she got that off her chest.

Speaking of chest, Robin could still feel his daughter’s chest rubbing against his face and was rendered frozen. Raven and Starfire floated down beside him to make sure he was alright. After seeing his grim future, they had been sticking close to him, determined to not let anything they heard come to pass. Robin stared at his round loves and groaned weakly. “I think my daughter just gave me a boner.”

Everyone got ready to go into Hell. The Batmans were prepared, the big bouncy women were ready to push their weight around, Cyborg was ready to confront Jinx for maybe the last time and Robin was ready to defy destiny, forging a new future. Two people weren’t ready though as they experienced a first, their first fight.

“What do you mean you’re not going?” Beast Boy exclaimed as he grabbed Terra by her shoulders. They had moved away from the others to talk alone, but what Terra wanted to talk about one thing that Beast Boy wasn’t ready to hear. She turned her face away from him, unable to look him in the eyes and lie strait to his face.

“What I mean is we just found out we’re going to die. I’m not going to go on a suicide mission, not to save two women I don’t even know.” Terra also didn’t say that she also didn’t want to go because that would mean confronting Slade again. When they had fought him last he had used demonic powers to nearly kill them all. Terra knew first hand how dangerous her teacher was and that fighting him now was hopeless. Let the others sacrifice themselves. Letting her friends die was an awful thing to do, but dying with them was just stupid.

“I can’t believe you’re leaving me.” This morning Beast Boy had woken up happier then he had ever been and now his newfound love was leaving him. It was so overwhelming he thought he might fall to his knees. Why did life have to be so Goddamn cruel?

“I don’t have to leave you,” Terra calmly said, reaching up to cup Beast Boy’s face in her hands. “Come with me. Leave the Teen Titans. Let them risk their lives we can be happy, together.”

This was the only way. If she remained with the Teen Titans she would die or Slade would force her to kill them. She was tired of being pulled between two lives, tired of loving a man and knowing someday, she’d betray him. It was time to end it. If she ran with Beast Boy, ran far away from everyone, Slade would let her go. He had more important things to worry about then a rouge henchgirl. They could live together in safety, and Beast Boy would never know her past.

“I…I can’t do that,” Beast Boy croaked, his voice weak as he did the hardest thing of his life. He removed Terra’s hands from his face and looked hard at her face ands felt his heartbreak. He’d die for her, but not abandon everything he believed in. His friends needed him, far more then Terra did.

“What do you mean you can’t! Doesn’t your life mean anything to you? Don’t I mean anything to you?” Terra spit angrily. None of this was supposed to happen, none of it was. Things were spiralling out of control and she needed to get out of here. Why couldn’t Beast Boy see that? He just looked at her sadly, unable to express something that she should already know. He was a hero and while Terra could live with abandoning her friends, Beast Boy couldn’t.

“Bye,” he simply said, no other words necessary as he walked away from the best thing to ever happen to him. He rejoined the others, putting on his mask of happiness so no one could see how much he hurt inside. This was killing him, but he couldn’t look back. This was his decision and the only comfort he got out of it was that Terra would be safe.

“You stupid, stupid fool,” Terra said as the tears started. None of this was supposed to happen, certainly not her falling in love. There he went, to die to protect someone else’s life. She wanted to hate him for leaving her, hate him for caring more about the lives of others then her own, hate him for doing this to her, but she couldn’t. He was being true to himself, just like she was being true to herself. She was a coward and because of that she was never going to see the only man she had ever loved again.

“Don’t cry, you’ll see him very soon.”

Terra stiffened when she heard the voice of the only man she had ever feared. Slade’s cold-gloved hand rested on her shoulder and in a flash of fire they were both gone to meet the Teen Titans further on.

“Lets move!” Batman commanded as he moved his team of heroes into the abandoned DMV and onwards into Hell. Robin followed, he might be the leader of the Teen Titans, but Batman had the highest authority. He looked at his future, walking beside him. He’d never end up like him, ever. Moving quickly between Starfire and Raven, he journeyed into Hell and an uncertain future.
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: Venturing Onwards

choices: Follow one of the Teen Titans
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
From the moment the heroes burst through the doors, a bright flash engulfed them and with the next step they took, they found themselves in another plain of existence. Immediately, the rotten stench of brimstone flooded their nostrils and the sweltering heat hit them like a ton of bricks. Given where they were, they were amazed that no one had already collapsed from a heat stroke. Right now, future Batman and Cyborg were glad they had built in fans, and Raven, Starfire, Nightstar, Catgirl, and Catwoman only sweated a little as their layers upon layers of skin created the perfect shielding from the heat.

Looking around, everyone felt like they were in some kind of underground cavern, only this one had stone walls that were red in collar, or maybe that was just the glow from the flames. They then realized that they were standing right on a winding walkway from high above, and beneath it, inhuman monsters flew through the air while down below fire blazed and lava flowed through this realm. They feared detection, but right now, the only demons they saw down below seemed to be mindless drones that could only shriek. Even if they wanted to stick around, this was no time for sightseeing, as Future Batman pointed out.

“Let’s move.” He said. However, before the group could even take their third step, Robin was suddenly in front of the pack. “No!” he stood before his future self, who by now was considering killing his past self for being so goddamn annoying. He wanted to know what the hold up was now, but fortunately, Robin answered.

“I can stand this anymore! Out of all the horrors my own mistakes have made me go through, there is no way in HELL that I would be you!” he pointed a guilty finger at someone who he saw as committing the ultimate crime. No one spoke a word, and once more, the future’s Batman saw that he was going to have to explain things to his past self.

“Do you remember how you used to never want to be Batman Tim? Remember how you thought just like Dick about that idea, and even went so far as to preach to Bruce in Gordon’s office during the riots last night to say that would never happen. “I’ll never be Batman, never.” It used to believe that to, with all my heart, but you and I both know we’d do it sooner or later.” He said. Still, Robin did not move.

“That’s not the problem! Even if Bruce died I would never become what you are!” Tim’s statement was simple and clear. Everyone could tell what was wrong with Future Batman, only he didn’t see them as flaws and said “The world got dark. I had to also. I just followed the trend.”

“You mean you gave up.” Robin said. After hearing that, Batman Beyond irritatingly sighed and moved ahead mumbling “Too optimistic.” However, as he walked, before he could stop him again, Robin finally noticed a larger than usual pocket in the back of his utility belt. No, it wasn’t a pocket, more like a holster, and within it, was something the real Batman would never use.

“What is that?” Robin suddenly found himself becoming frightened. His future self did not turn though, instead just took the gun out and looked to his side as he made sure it was fully loaded. He did however answer what he saw as another stupid question “The gun that killed Bruce’s parents. The demons cast a spell that lets one bullet kill anything, a lesson the Joker learned the hard way.” And just like when he insulted Robin, he then mumbled a compliment to himself “More sense,” and cocked the gun.

Suddenly, Robin felt all of his rage boiling to the surface. Before everyone, he let out a violent cry and grabbed his future self before ramming him into the wall. Catching him off guard, he laid four blows on his face before he returned to screaming.

“I’LL NEVER BE YOU! I used to fear that I’d turn out just like Bruce, but you’re the worst thing imaginable! You kill anyone you fight, you forgot what it truly means to be Batman, AND YOU DON’T CARE ABOUT YOUR OWN DAUGHTER OR ANYTHING EXCEPT THE GODDAMN MISSION!!!!” Robin told him. He was practically strangling his future, but all he saw was a scared little boy hiding behind a Halloween mask. However, that little boy now had a fire blazing in his eyes that was brighter than the ones that surrounded them.

“HOW DARE YOU?!” he shouted. With his enhanced strength he broke free and knocked Robin to the ground. The boy wonder’s head hung off the ledge but before anyone could step in, they saw Future Batman pull him back up so they were face to face.

“Listen and listen good Robin,” he snarled “I’m going through hell twice now in my life, but even after all this, I STILL remember what it was like when I was you. You don’t realize it now, but everything you’ve been through so far has been leading up to this moment. The first time you survived being eaten, joining the FJL, leading the Titans, fighting your own villains, and forming bonds with many heroes and heroines before finding the loves of your life, it has all come down to this, the ultimate test of what truly matters most to you, the one’s you love, or your own carnal desires. You don’t want to be what Slade said you’ll become, but if you don’t want to wind up as the sad sight you see before you, then you need to stop whining and keep on moving. I’m still in this fight because I still know that being a hero means putting yourself on the line for the safety of others, no matter what the cost to myself, so don’t you insinuate even for a SECOND that I don’t care.”

With that said, the Tomorrow Knight let him go and kept on moving. Robin just stood there and blinked for a second, before finally noticing the other heroes, who apparently had the super powers of standing still and saying nothing. However, he was glad that they caught all that, as he smiled and said “What’re you all standing around for? We’ve got to save Harley and Batgirl.”

With a flip of his cape, he headed off as well.

Soon the heroes reached the end of their destination. They were still high up, but the walkway was now leading them into a dark cave. Both Batmen and Robin pulled out flashlights from their belts and Starfire and Nightstar used their powers to light up their hands, but the deeper they got, the more the darkness seemed to envelope them and the lights quickly faded. Once more, before ANYONE could utter a word, everyone screamed as they plummeted! The only ones who didn’t shriek were the future heroes, as this was just like they remembered or were told about. The darkness, the falling, the group getting separated, it was all coming back to them. The only unknown was what the three of them would have to face this time.
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: Leading up to this moment

choices: What's happening with The Future Heroes?
What's happening with Batman and Catwoman?
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
“Robin! Robin! Where are you? Save me!” Raven screamed as she felt herself falling into the darkness. This was like her worst nightmare come to life. She was in Hell, her father’s realm, consumed by darkness and separated from her teammates and lover. She could feel the evil of this place calling to her. It sensed what was in her blood and was welcoming her home.
Fear, confusion and anger swirled inside of her, making it impossible for her to use any of her powers. She was falling deeper, unable to fight against the draw of Hell. She closed her eyes and gave a silent prayer for her teammates, but most of all Robin. She hoped the future the twisted and bitter Batman had said wouldn’t come true and he would be happy with Starfire.

“Do not worry lover Raven! I have got you!”

Thick, sweaty hands took hold of Raven’s hands and her fall creased. The darkness still surrounded her, but that was quickly dispelled by a bright green light coming from the hands keeping her from plunging down. Raven could see Starfire hovering above her, a carefree smile on her chubby face. The dangerous situation they found themselves in didn’t effect the cheerful alien princess as it did Raven. To Starfire, no danger could break her spirits.

“You mustn’t fret Lover Raven. Although I am not Robin, like him I would never let a person I love get hurt,” Starfire said nonchalantly, smiling happily as she stared into the second person she loved from Earth who remained speechless after hearing the declaration of love from Starfire. The words had come from her mouth before, but somehow they rung truer now then ever before to Raven. She hadn’t wanted to believe that Starfire really knew what love meant, it made things easier to think of her as only a friend that she sleeps with. However, now that she stared into the alien girl’s eyes in the worst place in creation and saw only affection in her gaze, Raven believed it now, wholeheartedly. It is the simplest things that make a truth realized, and this moment, this feeling Raven had, it was the confirmation she needed

“Thank you. I love you too Starfire,” Raven said, meaning it completely. She had loved Starfire since the first time she held the happy alien. She made Raven feel good about herself. Robin made her feel safe and loved, but Starfire was the only one that made her love herself. It was a confusing thing, but Raven understood now. She needed both of them, not just as lovers, but also as a family. They completed her in ways she never imagined.

“I know you love me, silly. But we must not get too mushy, we have a mission,” Starfire boldly exclaimed. “We will speak of love and make fucking after we are reunited with Robin and rescue Senior Batgirl and Harley.”

“Sounds good Starfire, only one thing, don’t call what we do make fucking, but instead call it making love. Because what we have Starfire isn’t fucking, it’s love.”

“Yes, I see that now,” Starfire slowly said and then nodded. Suddenly, Raven could feel the ground under her feet and a dim light appeared around them. Starfire looked around curiously, they were in a tunnel now, alone but safe. Raven knew what happened. Hell played tricks on the mind. They had been dragged into an illusion, but the sudden rush of emotions they felt broke it. As corny as it sounded, the strongest weapon you could have in Hell was love.

“We should continue forward and meet our friends, yes?” Starfire asked as she dropped down beside Raven. The smaller of the girl’s nodded her head and took Starfire’s hand. She wanted to feel her love’s hand in hers as they went deeper. She would need her comfort to resist the pull of this terrible place.

Deep, callous voices rumbled from ahead of Starfire and Raven, following the sound of dozens of loud footsteps. They screamed out to the darkness a manta of evil. “Rape! Kill! Destroy!”
“We got company,” Raven coldly said, a small smile on her face as she saw the enemy coming towards her. There was no fear in her now, not with Starfire beside her because much like Robin and Starfire, she would never let someone she loves get hurt.

“Yes, let us lick butt!” Starfire huffed and curled her fat fingers into a fist strong enough to crush solid rock. Raven didn’t correct Starfire, although she knew that there would be some butt licking when they got out of this, much dirty, messy butt licking.

Hideous forms rushed towards them. Misshapen limbs carried swords and axes, ready to eviscerate the both of them. Murder was in their eyes, but none of this moved Raven and Starfire. They would pulverize these monsters and move forward to meet with everyone else. The fires of Hell had nothing on the fires in their hearts propelling them forward. Raven was no longer afraid.



Beast Boy felt himself sliding down a long slide, blackness around him as he slid deeper. He tried turning into something big enough to stop his drop, but everything he turned into did nothing. Finally, he was thrown forward, landing face first on the warm, hard ground. Groaning, he slowly lifted himself up and blinked away the stars in his vision.

“Dude, what a rush,” he groaned as he got to his feet and dusted himself off. He had been separated from everyone, but he was okay. He could take care of himself down here. All he had to do was move forward and he’d meet up with everyone else. No reason to panic. He was just alone, in Hell, in the dark, probably surrounded by demons and other monstrosities.

“Mommy,” Beast Boy whimpered as he heard muffled screams from further on. Mustering up his courage, he turned himself into a bat and started flying forward. With the bats sonar he was able to identify his surroundings, but that did nothing to diminish his fears. He had no idea what he was going to face, but he tried not to dwell on that. He kept his mind occupied by wondering if Batman would like him as a new sidekick after this. The Caped Crusader could use a literal batboy as back up. He started to wonder if he’d have to wear those embarrassing green trunks if he became Batman’s sidekick when he spotted light up ahead. Turning back into regular Beast Boy, he crept towards it. Beast Boy stepped into the darkness and found himself in a large cave. Candles burned in a circle around a lone figure who kept their head down. But Beast Boy still recognized who it was right away.

“Terra! What are you doing here?” Beast Boy asked as he moved towards the girl who he loved and had abandoned him. He moved closer, opening his arms as he stared at the top of her skull. She kept her head down and said nothing, but Beast Boy could swear that he could hear her crying.

“Terra, are you okay?” He softly asked and reached towards her. The candles flickered and a huge rock lifted itself out of the air. It floated for several seconds and then flew towards a stunned Beast Boy.

“TERRA!”



“Damn! Damn! Damn! Damn!” Cyborg grunted every time he hit the ground. He was bouncing down a downwards slop, tumbling blindly forwards, completely blind and unable to stop. He kept trying to grab hold of anything, but his fingers just slid over the smooth ground. Growling in frustration, he kept his head down and wondered how many scratches and dents he was going to have when this was over. His bumpy fall kept to a stop when he hit something and was thrown forward. He landed face first between two soft, round objects.

“So the mighty hero makes his entrance.”

Cyborg groaned. He’d recognize that snide, condescending voice anywhere. Also, the springy orbs his face was caught between were familiar too. Pink light surrounded him and he stared up into the smirking face of the blubbery witch Jinx. He had landed between her huge hooters, which had made excellent air bags. He would have liked to keep his head right where it was, but he knew that wasn’t going to be possible.

“Hello Jinx,” Cyborg evenly said and pulled his head from her cleavage. He was in Hell on a rescue mission, what was between him and Jinx had to be put aside for now. He couldn’t dwell on the incredible night they spent together, which became a lot harder when he saw that Jinx was completely naked. He stared at her round, wide body. Her huge breasts bouncing on her chest as she breathed in the foul air deeply. Her large belly drooped down over her crotch, but Cyborg could clearly remember her tight pussy with pink hair surrounding it. Her fat ripples as she posed, pointed her chubby finger at him defiantly.

“Sorry lover boy, but I’m still working for Slade. So that means I got to kick, eat and digest your sorry ass. No mercy, not even for you. So prepare yourself and…. would you stop drooling!” Jinx screamed, not liking that way her villain monologue was being completely ignored.

Cyborg licked his wet lips, unable to take his eyes or mind off the portly hottie in front of him. “Why exactly are you naked?”

Jinx blushed, looking shyly away. “My clothes got a little sweaty so I took them off. It’s hot as Hell down here if you haven’t noticed.”

An awkward silence followed for a second later and then Cyborg started chuckling, Jinx joined him and soon both of them were laughing. It was uncomfortable fighting someone that you wanted to screw more then hit, neither one of them knew what to do. They knew what they were supposed to do, but neither of them felt like doing that. It was a standstill that only ended when Jinx came up with the only solution.

“Hey, you want to fuck me before we kill each other?”

“I sure do,” Cyborg answered as he grabbed hold of his sexy enemy and pulled her into a deep, open mouth kiss. He’d meet up with his friends later, first he had to deal with this awful super villain.



Robin was only falling for a few seconds before he hit the ground. He landed and rolled forward ready to fight. He didn’t have to wait long. A ten-foot tall ring of fire surrounded him, keeping him from retreating. Out of the fire, he stepped forward. Cold as ice even in the blazing fires of hell. He stared at Robin mockingly, daring the boy to make the first move.

“Hello Robin.”

“Hello Slade.”

And then the fight began.
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: The Landscape of Hell

choices: What's happening with Batman and Catwoman?
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
Like everyone else, the three heroes from the future also found themselves falling once they vanished into the darkness. However, unlike everyone else, they didn’t scream as they expected what was about to happen to them. Batman had told them many times about what had happened to him the moment he stepped into that cave, so their descent was not met with fear, but only with activating his rocket boots as he came down while Nightstar hovered down slowly and Catgirl landed on her feet.

“Stay close.” Batman reminded them. Just as he was certain that his younger self was fighting Slade right now, he knew that hell would shape up a challenge for them as well. As Carry’s trained eyes tried to look through the darkness and Nightstar did as her mom and lit up one of her fists for light, Batman switched on his night vision. He didn’t see anything but the three of them and this chamber they were in seemed to go on forever. Not about to be afraid of the dark, the heroes stepped forward…which turned out to be a big mistake as they were suddenly all pulled apart seemingly by the darkness itself.

“Nightstar? Batman?” Catgirl called out their names. One second she was ready to kick some demon ass and then the next it was like someone threw a black curtain in front of her as her friend and mentor vanished. Suddenly, she felt something moving behind her and turned her tubby body around to hiss at it.

“Carry?” she abruptly stopped however when a familiar voice said her name. She turned around fast and spotted Cassandra, aka the new Batgirl in her costume and reading some of her books. The sight of her presumed dead companion lifted Carry’s spirits. Inspired by the caped crusaders and orphaned as well, Cassandra had quickly become Carry’s best friend, and through her full face mask she asked “What are you doing stumbling around in the dark? Come over here, you’ve got to read this.” Smiling, Carry waddled over.

A few steps in however, a bullet came flying out of the front of Cassandra’s head, piercing all the way through the back of her skull in a spurt of blood. Carry screamed as she watched her friend collapse on her books as the pages turned red.

“Oh my god!” quickly though, Carry’s head swerved when she heard someone else cry out in horror. Out of nowhere, Nightstar suddenly appeared and flew to Cassandra. “No, don’t!” Carry shouted, but as soon as her friend and teammate held the body in her hands, the light went out and Carry heard her shriek. When it came back on, Nightstar’s huge body mostly enveloped Cassandra’s as she lied on top of her. Several stab wounds were on her chest as that whole area became nothing but a bloody mess.

“No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no!!” Carry said over and over, trying to tell herself what she saw wasn’t real. Too many times now she had seen people she loved slaughtered before her by evil forces. She remained on her knees and covered her ears as she shut her eyes, trying to block out everything. A cat, and for that matter someone who grew up in a hell on Earth was supposed to be able to take any horrific sight and keep moving forward. All this time that attitude had kept Carry from going insane, but now it finally felt like she couldn’t look past any of this anymore.

All of a sudden, she believed she was going crazy because when she opened her eyes, she found herself walking hand in hand with her parents! They weren’t in costume, and neither was she. In fact, she was eight years old! Her head darted left and right as she saw that they were walking down a sidewalk, with people and buildings actually around them. There were no wastelands, no demonic monsters, now ravaged bodies lying in the street, it was like she was still in he past, but this couldn’t be her past.

“I can’t believe you insisted on sitting through that movie twice Carry.” Bruce spoke to his daughter. She responded with an apology “I’m sorry daddy,” and her mom backed her up “Go easy on her Bruce, she really loved it. Besides, Alfred will wait.” Of course, even though she said what she had said, on the inside Carry asked herself “What movie?”

“Come on, we can cut through here.” Bruce said. It was starting to rain and they didn’t have their umbrellas. Fortunately, he spotted an alley that he knew would make an ideal shortcut. Selina wasn’t so sure about this idea, but naturally, she and her daughter hated getting wet so they took daddy’s advice. It seemed like they were home free until someone stepped out from the shadows with a revolver.

“Wallet, jewelry, now!” the man demanded. Everyone was frozen in fear, but Bruce tried reasoning with the man that he’d get what he wanted, and that no one had to be hurt. Now Carry had no idea what was going on, but she understood this even less. Her dad ate punks like this for breakfast, although not quite like her mom did, so why was he giving this guy the wallet?

It seemed like this unfortunate incident was about to end when the wallet slipped as Bruce tried to hand it to the man. He tried to pick it up, but his swift movements made the man misinterpret it as the start of an attack, so he pulled the trigger. A loud bang echoed throughout the alleyway before Bruce Wayne fell to the ground.

“Bruce! Oh god, BRUCE! Carry run!” Selina shouted. Suddenly, her husband’s murderer struck again as he not only ripped the pearls from her neck, but pulled the trigger again.

“Mommy!” Carry’s cries did nothing to halt the mugger as he ran off and disappeared. She fell to her knees before the bodies of her parents and as tears poured from her eyes, their blood stained her dress. All these years she couldn’t help but imagine what the final moments of her mom and dad must have been like, but now it clear that not knowing was a blessing in disguise. Nothing mattered to her right now, especially not her current age. She had been trained, she should have done something!

“What’s the matter Carry?” at first she thought she was hearing things, but looking back up, she saw her father looking at her. His eyes were completely white like when he wore his mask. Carry knew this thing wasn’t her father, even if it looked like him. Still, just hearing it speak, she had never felt more terrified in her life “Not enjoying the family tradition?”






“Hello? Hello?” Nightstar called out more loudly than last time. She knew this could potentially lead god knows what to finding and attacking her, but walking around in nothing but pitch black was really starting to get to her. Not to mention, even with her kind and caring heart, given the world she grew up in, her mom couldn’t exactly tell her that there was nothing to be afraid of in the dark.

“Nightstar?” not only did she suddenly hear someone else’s voice, but it was one she’d recognize anywhere. Turning her head, she saw Starfire standing a few feet away from her. Naturally she asked “Mo-…I mean, Starfire, what’re you doing here?”

“Oh, I know our mission at hand is dire, but after hearing what you said to Robin, I just had to tell you that although we have just met before your conception, that I love you daughter.” Starfire sounded so nervous when she started, but at the end, she spoke so softly and sincerely. It touched Nighstar deeply, and she saw her mom open her flabby arms to her.

“Please, may I have the hug?” she asked. Any child of Starfire would never turn down that offer, but just before she got there, a loud bang rattled her ear drums. She wearily looked back at her daughter before falling to the ground with a sickening thud. Nightstar had no time to scream as she saw the Joker holding the smoking gun.

“MURDERER!” hovering, she flew at her mother’s killer, but as soon as she took her first swipe, he was gone. She looked in all directions, but the next thing she saw was…Starfire?!

“Dearest daughter, what is wrong?” she asked. Before Nightstar could wrap her head around what she was seeing, a monster leaped out of the shadows and pinned her past mother. It looked like a giant insect with white skin and purple eyes. A Tameranian Chrysalis eater, her mom had told her about those things. The next thing she knew, Starfire shrieked just before that thing bit a huge chunk out of her neck. Just as the beast began having the feast of a lifetime, those two vanished as well.

It kept on happening over and over again, when ever Starfire would appear, so would another death, and just to fuck with Nightstar even more, sometimes it was even the adult version of her mom that she knew. Blackfire came up behind her and snapped her neck, blasted a hole clean through her, crushed her into a bloody pulp by squashing her, and then Slade took her black, by slicing her in half with his sword, burning her alive in a pillar of fire, and then finally he slipped down her mouth like he was water, only to have Starfire clutch her belly and then scream in agony as she was blown apart from the insides, coating her daughter in her entrails!

Nightstar shrieked as she lied kneeling in the middle of a field of dead Starfires.






Batman didn’t cry for help or even try to find the others. Instead, he kept on moving forward, ready to face what ever hell through at him a second time. Every step he took was loudly heard as he continued walking through nothing but pitch black. His stroll through oblivion ended however when he saw double doors ahead of him. Stepping in front of it, he readied himself as he pushed them open.

Once inside, the Batarang in his hand now seemed useless as he found himself inside of a morgue. The lights were flickering and it was bone chillingly cold. The drawers that were supposed to house bodies were empty, but instead of that being a good thing, the doors were constantly swinging back and forth, the sound of metal clanging filled the room. What was even more distinct though to Batman, were disembodied voices constantly whispering in his ear “You don’t belong here, get out,” or “Your soul shall be trapped.” He tried to ignore everything and made his way inside.

In the center of the room sat two body bags on some tables. Guessing he was supposed to open them, Batman pulled down the zipper on the one on the right. What he saw was a corpse wearing his cowl.

“Bruce?” he said. As he stared into the blank, white eyes of the body, suddenly his dead father figure spoke to him! The corpse said “Why didn’t you save us Tim?” He had been trained by the greatest vigilante in history and yet when he needed him most, Robin had gotten his ass kicked so badly he had to leave his father to his doom, he knew that’s what Bruce was thinking.

The music of a baby’s mobile began playing in the room as Batman moved back quickly. Unfortunately, he bumped into the other table, which prompted him to reluctantly open the other bag, revealing the sagging, rotted, pale body of his surrogate mother “Selina?”

“Help us Tim! Don’t let us die!” she begged. By now, Batman was becoming horrified by everything he had seen, but then Selina reached up and stroked his cheek! He pushed it away and bolted for the door before the bodies could get out of their bags. They just watched their terrified son try to escape, but as soon as he got to the door, the lights went out.

He tried to turn on his night vision, but none of his equipment worked. Suddenly, he found himself standing in a single beam of light. Stumbling, he soon backed into someone who just appeared on the edge of the light. Turning his head, he saw the frightening mask of Scarecrow!

The villain cackled as his eyes glowed and he waved his gloved hand that was covered in hypodermic needles! Consumed by fear, Batman stumbled back while unknowingly turning back into a teenaged Robin. Speaking of which, he then found himself face to face to face with Two Face, the villain who had taken it upon himself to hunt down Robins as much as Batman. The very sight of him flipping his coin to decide Robin’s fate made him yelp and rush off. However, just as he turned back into looking like he did when he first joined Batman, only to run right into Slade!

Falling onto his rear, the young Robin was almost near tears from how terrified he was. Surrounded on all sides by his most terrifying foes, he remained frozen in the middle of the light. Suddenly the doors he came in appeared once more and another villain stepped in and began approaching the trembling boy wonder, wearing his tacky purple suit.

“Behind all the stern and Batarangs, you’re just a little boy in a play suit crying for mommy and daddy. It’d be funny it weren’t so pathetic…oh what the heck, I’ll laugh anyway, AHAHAHAHAHA!!!”
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.title: Feed the eternal sadness of mortals

choices: What's happening with The Future Heroes?
What's happening with Batman and Catwoman?
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
Dodging past fireballs as fast as his legs would let him, Robin jumped behind a huge boulder and avoided being incinerated by Slade’s next blast of Hell fire. Swearing under his breath, Robin put out a small fire on his cape with his hands and then ripped his cape off. It was only hindering him in his fight with the empowered villain and the last thing Slade needed was anymore of an advantage. He’d been fighting the world class assassin for several minutes, and by fighting, Robin meant running for his life. He couldn’t get ten feet within the villains sights before a wave of fire would come racing towards him. Robin was getting tired from running, but unless he came up with a plan, he was doomed. What would Batman do in this kind of situation?

“Give it up Robin, we we’re evenly matched when I was just a man, but with the powers the demons gave me, you don’t stand a chance.”

The sound of Slade’s voice was coming from everywhere, giving Robin no clues if the monster was a hundred feet away or right on top of him. Clutching his staff tightly, Robin weighed his options. Running was getting him nowhere and he couldn’t get close to Slade. He needed to go at this another way by attacking his enemy psychologically. “Slade, if this is the part where you tell me to join you or die then spare me. I’m not like you, I’ll never be.”

Robin felt it first. Things had been hot ever since coming to this place, but suddenly it got a lot warmer just above Robin’s head. Looking up, he saw Slade perched on the boulder he was hiding being, arms out ready to blow Robin away. Staring into his one dead, cold eye, Slade spoke with an eerie calm that put a shiver down Robin’s spine. “You are right, you could never be like me, you’re too weak. Also, only worthy opponents can call me Slade. Weaklings like you are only allowed to call me by my professional name, DEATHSTROKE!”

Robin could feel the end of his hair get singed as he rolled out of the way just in time from Deathstroke’s attack. Not bothering to look back, Robin tried to run for cover, his mind rushing to find an answer on how to defeat the stronger, faster and magically empowered assassin. The last time he had fought Slade he had his team, his friends, to back him up, but now he was just alone. No Starbolts from this robust alien lover to knock the enemy back. No magic from his pale, sexy bedmate to keep his opponent on his toes. No random animals from his shape-changing friend to distract his adversary. No back-up from his half robotic comrade to keep his foe off target. All alone, without even his mentor, Robin felt helpless for the first time in a long time.

“What’s wrong Robin, scared?” Deathstroke taunted and Robin fought the urge to turn around and fight him head on. He felt helpless, but that didn’t frighten him. He’d been helpless before and fought back, being powerless only angered him. He had thought that he was ready to deal with these kind of situations when he formed his own team. He thought he was man enough to stand on his own two feet, but he had been wrong. He wasn’t a super hero, he was only a sidekick that had found himself in too deep.

“I’m not scared and I’m not weak!” Robin screamed back, ducking another blast as he changed direction. The darkened underground of Hell seemed to go on forever, but if Robin could find the high ground, he might be able to mount an offence against Deathstroke. “You think just because I love sex and large women that I’m weak. Just because I know how to enjoy myself doesn’t make me any less of a hero.”

Robin threw his staff directly at Deathstroke like it was a javelin. He was hoping the weapon would knock his foe back and give him an opening to strike back. The tip of his staff neared Deathstroke, but as it got within inches of his face, Deathstroke’s arm blurred forward and he grabbed Robin’s staff before it could hit him. Tossing Robin’s weapon away casually, he calmly stared at Robin. “You really are a fool.”

Deathstroke was on Robin instantly. Robin suspected the demons had also increased Deathstroke’s speed because he was moving at inhuman speeds, jabbing at Robin with lightning fast blows. His fists burned as they rocketed towards Robin’s head. There were several close calls and Robin was running out of steam. He couldn’t get any offence going and it was quickly looking like he was going to lose, but the worst part was that through all of it, Deathstroke kept talking.

“You think that I consider you weak because of your sex life? Don’t make me laugh! Sex doesn’t make you weak, having lust doesn’t make you weak, caring for other’s doesn’t make you weak. What makes you weak Robin is that you don’t know what you’re fighting for.”

“What?” He was distracted for a fraction of a second, but that was all the time Deathstroke needed to land a devastating punch to Robin’s midsection. Pain erupted inside Robin. It felt like someone had set a bomb off inside his body when Deathstroke hit him. He was thrown back several feet and would have gone flying further if he didn’t hit a wall. He crashed into the wall with a sickening thud. Slumping forward, Robin took several ragged breaths. He had several cracked ribs, maybe one broken rib, all from one punch from Deathstroke. Weakly lifting his head, he watched Deathstroke calmly walk towards him, stopping to pick up Robin’s own discarded staff. Deathstroke spent several seconds studying the weapon, testing its weight and density. Certain that it could take the strain, Deathstroke calmly walked towards Robin to bludgeon him to death.

“Weakness doesn’t come from what we do in our spare time or what we feel outside the battlefield. It’s how we fight when on the battlefield that matters. You lack the one thing that makes all great heroes or villains, purpose.”

“Explain!” Robin spit out as he unsteadily crawled to his feet. He was listening to Deathstroke, trying to understand what he meant. His fears and doubts had been troubling him since his first meeting with Slade when he pointed out how much he prized his sex life. Now he was saying that what he did with the girls didn’t matter. What was the madman saying.

“Simple. I fight for something, something I believe in completely with my heart, I never doubt, I never worry, I stay only focused on my mission. You have no clear idea what you fight for. Justice? It’s been perverted so much since your league took over that you no longer know what it means. Your captured friends? You blame yourself for their capture and believe that if you fail to save them someone else will. Your lovers? You fear you’ll never be able to love them as much as they deserve. You fear you will never have what your mentor and his feline lover will have. You fear you’re not worthy. You fear you’ll let them down. Without a real purpose to believe in, your fear has crippled you! So let me put you out of your misery Robin! Let me show you that all this while you should have been fearing me!”

Deathstroke swung down at Robin to knock him down a final time. Everything seemed to happen in slow motion as Robin saw his own weapon head towards him. He didn’t have enough time to dodge, so that only left one option. He’d fight, he wouldn’t strike from the darkness like Batman, he’d fight his way. Reaching into his utility belt, Robin grabbed the only weapon he carried the Batman hadn’t given to him or to be more precise, the only weapon the Batman from his time hadn’t given him. It looked like a red and gold baton with Robin’s symbol engraved on the top. Robin blocked Deathstroke’s finishing blow with the baton and as the weapon’s met, electricity crackled around them.

“Meet the future of crime fighting tech, bitch!”

Robin’s staff was a perfect conductor for the thousand volts of raw electricity in his future baton. His grumpy future self had given it to him after he confronted him in Hell. He hadn’t said anything, just nodded and handed it to him. Robin had figured out how to use his new tool all by himself. He had to do this by himself and he did. He relished the look of surprise in Deathstroke’s one eye as enough juice to light up Jump City raced through his body.

“GGAAAHHH!” Robin would never dream that the sound of another’s scream could sound so good, but hearing Deathstroke cry out in agony made him forget all about his cracked ribs. Deathstroke’s body convulsed as the electricity raced through him until he let go off Robin’s staff and stumbled back. Electricity still crackled around his body as he fought to stand up as his agony continued. Robin stared impassively at him, never taking his eyes off him as he walked towards his weakened opponent.

“Thanks for the talk, I needed that shock to my system,” Robin calmly said as he reached down for his fallen staff. Retaking his weapon, he pointed it at a weakened and aching Deathstroke. “Your right, I don’t know what I feel and what I believe in. I don’t know if I’ve mistaken lust for love or justice for power, but I know this, I love my friends, I love the women I sleep with and I love protecting all of them. Maybe I’ll never know true love, but I know what I fight for; I fight for everyone!”

With a war cry from both of them, Robin and Deathstroke raced towards each other ready to fight to the end. They each fought for something that pushed them to never back down, but only one of them had the will to be the last man standing.

What's happening to Batgirl and Harley?
1422311121111111112111221111111112222211.content:
“Selina? Selina?” Batman called out. He and Catwoman were separated the moment they fell through the darkness just like everyone else, and even for the Dark Knight, being surrounded by nothing but a black abyss, let alone one right smack dab in the middle of hell was starting to get to him. Through the darkness, Catwoman was calling out to him as well, but whether they were only a foot away or miles apart, the abyss masked their presences from one another. Eventually though, Batman stopped calling out for his wife and just prepared himself for what ever the demonic forces were going to throw at him.

All of a sudden, he became engulfed in the light of the Bat Signal. As the symbol shined at his feet and he shielded his eyes, bats came flying out of nowhere, biting and clawing at him as they flew by. He covered himself in his cape, but right when they stopped and he tried to look back up, someone ran forward and kicked him. Batman fell, but grunted and got back up. As he did, the person who attacked him stood before him, and what he saw had Batman saying “You’ve got be kidding me.”

“Like looking in a mirror isn’t it?” Standing before him was another Batman, only this one had a different bat on his chest, and the creepiest grin on his face. Any fear Bruce might have still had quickly diminished as he saw just how predictable this was going to be.

“Hardly, I never smiled back then, until recently I haven’t had a reason to smile. So let me guess, you’re going to try and convince me that I was somehow better off back then than I am now, and the only way to get back to my true state is to forget my mission?” the real Batman said to the phony.
